text: Oh my goodness by far the best calamari salad I have ever had! The dressing was lite yet not to the point where I couldn't taste it! Yummy! I would go back just for that!
Absolute perfection ! The dinners were art at it's finest. Swine schnitzel like you were in germany, and the deserts too !  Lots of options, with natural meats and plenty for the vegetarian as well.

We enjoyed yesterday's evening meal at the Tonto Bar and Grill so much that I am writing this review this morning.  Our wait staff and servers-Jennifer and Katie Rose-were friendly and professional, and the arrival of everything from water to dessert and coffee was perfect.

So was the food.  We enjoyed our choices so much that I would happily order everything again:  corn chowder and harvest salad, sandals and walleye, and a to live for (!) chocolate cake served with coconut sorbet.

Everything was fresh and cooked to perfection.  We were told that the restaurant sources local grown and organic ingredients, which is to our liking as we mostly eat only organic at home.  

Our meals were as tasty and satisfying as our experience was romantic and blissful.  We look forward to returning soon!
The food is awesome, as is the service. Tonto Bar NEVER disappoints. Go.

Had lunch there with a friend, great food Penna pasta with tenderloin tips. WOW, really good, the chicken corn chowder is out of this world!! Great service to boot!! I have been going here for 10 years and have never had bad service, you will have a great time with excellent food!!
My wife and I have always been happy with the food and service.  We have happily spent many a special occasion here.  We will continue to go back.

Met some friends here. Ate on the outside back covered patio. They had heaters and it was wonderful! Not too hot or cold. Started with an arugula salad. It was ok. I think it could have had a bit more flavor. Then had the special which was bacon wrapped scallops with risotto and asparagus. Scallops melted in my mouth. The bacon was a bit fatty but the scallops were cooked perfectly. The risotto and asparagus was wonderful as well. Drank a cosmo and skipped dessert. We had good service. One of the other couples come here a lot and say it is always good food and service and our experience was the same. Make sure you have a reservation especially if you want to eat outside.

3 stars mainly for the entrees. 

The bar service was lacking and the wrong vintage of wine was served to us that was far less in substance but not in price than what was on the wine list.  The manager seemed apologetic but offered no discount. We left 1/2 the bottle sitting on the table. :(

The entire meal was saved by the entrees. The root beer braised beef short ribs were superb in taste and tenderness. The ancho rubbed beef fillet was quite enjoyable.

Stopped by for drinks and appetizers in the afternoon . What  a beautiful setting on patio looking out  towards golf course and mountains  . This place is first rate inside and out , will be back for dinner next trip

The location is stunning but the rest...EH!
This is the 3rd visit in three weeks.. two lunches and one dinner. My biggest disappointment is the staff. The first time we had a lovely waitress but the other two times, the wait staff was surly and prickly. It's as if none like their job. The bussers brusquely took the plates complaining that they were heavy. One fellow collected the silverware  clanging it on the collection of plates. There were other issues that make me unwilling to go back. 
The ladies restroom is tight, nasty and hard to get the towel dispenser to work. 
I love the varied menu. Tonto Grill has a lovely patio with heaters and umbrellas; it has the potential to be a five star.

I love this place. I have been going here since i moved to the valley and have never ever been even remotley close to disappointed! every single thing i have had here has been delcious. i usually start with the ahi temura roll then i move onto soup, i love a good corn chowder and tonto has some of the best, slightly smokey and nice and chunky, i have tried almost everything on the menu and usually notice when they add something new (such as the butternut squash soup) excellent! my favorite entree item so far has been the chilean sea bass which just melted in my mouth. I think it was a featured item though because i have not seen it since. service is always good and the atmosphere is excellent, i recogmend a nice sun set dinner on the patio.

Our little family went here for lunch on a Sunday. We go there before the lunch crowd and we were totally digging the scenery. We sat in the closed in patio over looking the golf course. My husband has played the course a few times which started a conversation about moving to a golf course. That's another story...

We went hoping for a brunch, but all the items on the menu (even weekends) are lunch/dinner items. However, the special for the day was bananas foster waffles. We both go that and, oh my goodness, was it good!!!  I didn't eat again until late that night and it put us both in a food coma. The orange syurp was amazing and everything went so well together! 

The downfall was our mimosas were about the same price as our entrees, so our total bill was $60 for breakfast. However, I do get to go back in a couple of weeks for a reception with some fellow alumni, so I am happy to know I will be trying other foods there also!

I've now given Tonto Grill 2 opportunites to wow me but they can't seem to get it right. First visit I had the walleye fish. The fish was dry, under seasoned and overcooked. The best part of the meal were the carrots and potatoes. Second trip was last night and they missed the mark again. I got the short ribs which were fine but didn't blow me away. They were stringy and more fat than meat. As for the service...I got the excellent arugula salad as an appetizer but unfortunately didn't get to finish it because the server thought she should throw all the food at us at once, rather than pay attention to whether we were finished with appetizers before sending entrees. Since there were space limitations on the table, I had to give up the delicious salad or deal with a cold entree because the beef, potatoes and green beans were already barely lukewarm. I have been disappointed twice now and won't go back. There are too many other restaurants that get it right to waste my time or money here. A BIG disappointment!

To celebrate our anniversary and my aunt's 82nd birthday we decided to go to Tonto. My aunt made a 5pm reservation for the outdoor patio. She and my uncle arrived on time and were seated at a table they did not like. Since there were many vacant seats closer to the golf course they asked to be moved. At that time they were told that those tables were reserved. My husband and I arrived a few minutes later and he spoke to the host. Eventually they allowed us to move but let's just say the whole ordeal was quite embarrassing and I am shocked that elderly people would be treated that way for no reason. The place did fill up, however, there were always open tables in the desirable spots so I have no idea why they took such a hard stance in the beginning. I never quite got over it and for that reason alone I will not go back and do not recommend.

We had a delicious lunch here sitting outside on the patio which overlooks the golf course.  I had a special of beef stroganoff made from short ribs and crimini mushrooms that was excellent.  The house made bread was good.  Service was excellent.

This is an old standard of Cave Creek. One of the places that seasonal visitors and locals look to for a special memorable dinner to enjoy the incredible beauty of AZ...Save it for later people....absolutely terrible. 
My Eighty year old parents and myself were driven out by rude, un-accommodating staff that basically just don't understand respect. Food is incredibly overpriced and mediocre with impersonal run through wait staff that attacked us for leaving. On the way out the other foursome that left bonded with us to go enjoy dinner somewhere down the trail. So that was good. 
Overall, What a shame. Tonto should be great. So sad. Don't waste your money and dignity.

I enjoyed a pleasant lunch here with my carefree grandparents-in-law who recommended Tonto as a delicious place. When we first entered the I thought it might be full of retirees and rich Arizonians but I was pleasantly surprised to find a crowd of all sorts enjoying lunch on the outdoor patio overlooking a pretty view of the golf course and elegant Saguaros. Elegantly Casual American describes Tonto. 

Indeed it's pricey, but the food is fresh, creatively presented and delicious. (Extra pluses for using locally-sourced ingredients) 
I enjoyed the Mexican white shrimp tacos. The petite shrimp comes drenched in a sassy ancho chili green pepper sauce, complemented by a cool and zesty cabbage-carrot-cilanto slaw, avocado cream sauce and chewy homemade white corn tortillas. The fun is getting to assemble your own tacos. I ate nearly every bite and was stuffed for most of the day. 

My companions enjoyed the Reuben sandwich (layered corned beef on crispy rye, served with skinny fries that don't need ketchup) and the Halibut served on potato cake with spinach and carrot salad. Grandma-in-law said the halibut was tender and flavorful. I can imagine a bunch of friends or foodies mingling and laughing, sipping wine in relaxed delight as you drink in the beautiful view. 

Worth a visit, whether you're a local foodie or traveler.

Just had an excellent dinner here the other night - we had great service on a very busy night (the Final Four games were on), too.

My meal:
Three Sisters salsa trio: nice way to start a meal for a group. Three different salsas (two red, one green) with homemade tortilla chips and fry bread. 

Barbeque glazed salmon over squash/sweet potato hash and a tamarind sauce: I haven't had a salmon dish this good/unique in a long time. Highly recommended.

And, the obligatory margarita (known as a "Tontorita" here) - very good.

We sat inside, but the outdoor seating area looked great! Hoping to visit again someday soon to enjoy the outdoor setting in person.

Excellent food, worth the price, the menu has classics (your choices of burgers and mesquite-grilled meats) and some more imaginative dishes. A good choice (5+) of salad bases to combine with either of 5+ meat/fish small portions on top. The "three sisters" salsa and breads starter is a local favorite and worth a try. 

It does not get five stars for two main shortcomings
- Wine list: pretentious and overpriced (and the wine by the glass is more by the half glass)
- Service: we got our mains while we were hardly 1/2 way our shared starter. And we were not the only ones that evening nor in the list of review. I smell a trick to try and maximize table turnover. Management was sensitive to bitter complaining, though (free creme brulee which was far too heavy anyhow)
Good place to get off the main street and away from the noise,great food also,take someone you like.....patrick

This is my families favorite restaurant! We usually cook at home but when we go out we choose Tonto Bar and Grill.  We LOVE their grass fed hambergers.  Try it with a huge portobella mushroom and swiss!!! Sit outside and smell the fresh cut grass from the golf course too!!

First time eating here last Friday night. My date said it was delicious.  She was right. The small dining  room was crowded for a Friday, especially right before the Balloon festival. Are server Mary Lousie was attentive and explained in detail the specials and the menue items. We choose to do the fresh Salmon with sphagetti squash and the Beef Tenderloin. Since we told her we wanted to share she split the meal for us without any charge. We have a small salad. The wines by the glass were limited but good. We choose the La Crema. Driving and wine tasting in AZ is not a good idea. The meal came promptly and boy was the encrusted salmon to die for.  The beef tenderloin was soft and at medium perfect.  The portions are large at the average price per entry of $22-35. You might be asking for a doggy bag for your spoiled pup.  Since it was a date set up by her daughter one of the hostesses the server must have known. He he.,  When we told her no room for desert she insisted.  Next came out a cold plate with a special box filled with two homemade truffles compliments of the chef.  Wow what a treat. Also it was nice touch to have the frozen writing on the plate tell us to enjoy this every.   This place will certainly be a highly recommendation for the special event when I am looking to splurge a little. Bravo to the staff and Chef.

I had a good meal here.  A couple of things to know:

- I read a review on here calling this place casual.  I wouldn't call it casual.  There were two of us who went after hiking and I felt a little uncomfortable wearing our hiking gear even at a late lunch around 3pm.

- We sat on the back patio and it was beautiful!  Great views!

- This place is not cheap.  It was over $60 for two of us for lunch.  We each had a salad and one glass of wine.

Beautiful views, good food.  Just want to make sure you know what to expect.

Both the food and the service were excellent. We initially requested a table in the sun but then changed our minds as it got quite hot quite fast. The staff graciously moved all of our drinks and appetizers to our new table without a fuss. 

The food was delicious - a little pricey but combined with the view, it was just right. The view is breathtaking. Beware of the margaritas. They are scrumptious and sneak up on you quite quickly!

So I just wrote a very honest review of Cartwrights, which I HATE. This place I love. Odd considering they are owned by the same people.

Anyway, this is a really good place to eat. I recommend keeping it simple. The appetizers are great, can't go wrong with any of them. They claim the best burger in the valley and you know what? They may be right. It is fantastic. The shrimp tacos are also very very good.

If I had a criticism, it would be that some of the more complicated entrees are a little "out there" but there is enough great food on the appetizer and sandwich menu to have a great experience.

Furthermore, sit at the bar, thats where it's at. The bartenders are great and never fail to deliver great service and mix very good cocktails.

Don't waste your money. I understand they used to be good.
Employees had a very bad attitude and were not helpful. We had reservations but were stuck next to the kitchen doors. That was fun and very loud. Asked to be seated else where but denied, even though tables were empty for the entire time. 
Food was very poor for the expensive price. VERY POOR.  Very Expensive. Not a good value and extremely disappointing. WE had heard good comments, but they did not turn out.
They had kids as hostesses and wait staff on duty. It is not their fault, as they had not been trained. It is management and owners fault.
Tonto is a good example of a restaurant depending on their old rep. Has not been updated in years, old and tired looking.
Too bad.

This has been my go to place for 8 years.  Service was just adequate at best.  Had to send my fish back several times as it was not cooked well as requested.  A highlight was always the delicious bread basket but now you have to request and there is a charge.  Disappointed...I am wondering if there has been a management change.
Everything is outstanding, the service, food and views. I highly recommend reservations during sunset to enjoy the awesome views to go with your delicious dinner

Awesome atmosphere... a little pricey, but worth it if the weather is right and you can sit on the patio and watching the golfers play. Service was slightly slow today at lunch, but the experience was enjoyable as we were in no rush. The indoor seating was empty and I would hesistate to go here if I had to sit inside.

Had the BLT with sweet potato tots. My husband had the corn beef. Both were very good.

I would recommend this restaurant. Great view of the golf course. Have yet to play the course.

Im giving this place a 1-STAR because of the RACIST and UNPROFESSIONAL seaters/hostesses they currently have. I went there with a literally old friend of mine yesterday and did NOT find these two "girls" friendly and accommodating at all. They were shocked the moment I came in with this American friend of mine because Im an ASIAN and younger than the rest of the crowd. They were just staring at me for the longest time that made me feel "UNWELCOME" instead of helpinge and my friend. They might have even thought that I could not afford any of their meals. If they only knew how much a Nurse Practitioner (and soon to be a Nurse Anesthetist in Honor Health Thompson Peak) like I make, then they're gonna realize that I can order their most expensive meal and wine everyday. Their salary combined wont even amount to a fourth of what I make. Anyway, we went there because my friend wanted to reminisce because it was her and her husband's favourite restaurant.

So on our way out, they were still staring at me OFFENSIVELY. They could not help but just stare at me disgustingly (SPECIFICALLY THE BLONDE hostess). I dont think the management did a good job of picking the right people specifically the "front row" of the business. Too bad every body else is also complaining about their NEGATIVE experience with their STAFF.

If the restaurant owners are reading this bad review, please, TRY to train your hostesses. Your business will go downward spiral because of your nasty staff. Their actions are UNACCEPTABLE, RACIST AND INTOLERABLE. Those two girls just made your company look ao bad so Im expecting that these two will either be sanctioned, fired or trained (at least).

Wow, quick slide downhill for a formerly reliable and favorite restaurant.

I brought three visiting family members from out of town for dinner just before 6pm today.  The main patio was full and we were offered the option of bar patio, which was empty except for one other party.  
Placed a drink order promptly. Took about 10 minutes for my drink to arrive; server said she "forgot" my brother's order (Coors Light).  Slightly annoyed, he just requested water, not wanting to wait another 10 minutes for something to drink.  
Another wait until server returned for order.  After we placed our order, two more parties arrived and were quickly served meals...still no food for us.  Server reappears with a bread basket that was not ours, then disappears for another 15 minutes.  Finally server returns and apologized for delay, said we were at 25 minutes  (wrong, it was at least 40 minutes) and she knew that was too long, said kitchen was busy and order would be "right up".   Another 10 minutes passed, at which point I went inside looking for manager.  Initial waitperson I spoke to simply walked away.  Another person realized I needed help and got the manager.  Manager indicated she would check on order and offered cocktails.  I replied we just wanted our food. Less than a minute later, the food arrived.  Clearly, it had been sitting for at least 15 minutes, as evidenced by room temp food and congealed cheese on Ruebens and burgers.  Disgusting.  We got up and walked out; after 75 minutes our patience was shot, and clearly there was to be no satisfactory and timely resolution.  What should have been a nice relaxing evening had been ruined.

A server who is incompetent is bad enough, but the issue extends to management if there is no process in place to insure that customers are being attended to in order and that plates do not sit around unclaimed.  Before sending this sorry food out to us, there should have been some inquiry by the manager as to what the issue was and the quality/timing of the food.  Serving up inedible food after an extended wait simply amplifies the bad experience.  Totally inexcusable.

We have eaten here a few times in the past, so hoping for a nice lunch on Sunday June 7 we arrived for lunch shortly after 12:30pm.  The dining room was less than half full and we were immediately seated right next to a table of 12 or more ladies.  The hostess left us with a menu and there we sat.  For just over 10 minutes we sat waiting for someone/anyone to acknowledge us, bring us water or promise to be right with us.  We watched the hostess glancing around from her podium and wait staff gathered at their station, and after a couple more minutes we decided that was enough and got up to leave.  We walked directly past the hostess on our way out the door and she didn't say a word.  We won't go back.

The first place we take friends visiting from out of state. Very well done southeast style design. If the weather allows sit outside on spacious patio. Service is always friendly and professional. Food is consistently good. Only issue for me is that the menu offerings rarely change.
Wow, our friends recommended Tonto Bar and Grill and so glad they did.  A wonderful meal, great service, ambiance....what more can you ask for.

Ha, how I long for the good old days! The days when you would sit in the back patio of Tonto Bar and Grill, soak up the great atmosphere while anxiously awaiting a succulent dish to please your pallet and a healthy appetite.

Well, those days are gone!  Our experience last night left us so disappointed. The passion to deliver a total quality dining experience is gone and so are we, never to return again.
 
It's about the money now, your money, and how much they can get for as little as they can give. So keep in mind, these restaurants that once burned brightly have a responsibility to earn your business every time you pull a chair up to their table. Tonto Bar and Grill's light has been extinguished only to be surviving off a once was reputation.

My husband and I came here for a date night.  The food was excellent, the drinks were good, and service was wonderful.  I loved the ambiance!  It was a little pricey, but worth it.  We sat next to the fireplace on a cold, rainy evening so our table was VERY romantic.  I highly recommend this restaurant if you're celebrating a birthday or anniversary!

Went here with a friend for lunch last Saturday afternoon. We had soup and salad that was mediocre at best. Ordered a lemon drop that was so-so and over priced. On the positive side, there is a good view of the golf course.

My husband and I love Tonto Bar and Grill. We live in Cave Creek and visit Tonto Bar and Grill often, never disappointed.  Nice South West atmosphere, excellent service. Pleasant view of the golf course from the outside patio. You may even get a glimpse of a bob cat or coyote snooping around. My favorite food for lunch is the Reuben sandwich. It is big enough to share. It is a little spicy because it has some jalapeno peppers but you can ask them not to add, sweet potato tots are very tasty. My husband loves their Golden Corn Chowder soup. Salads are always very fresh and crispy and also big enough to share. Highly recommended!

Had lunch in the New Year's Day 70 degree sun along the golf course so that was a plus right there.  My Mom and I enjoyed a delicious lunch (cobb salad with calamari side, street tacos with white shrimp).  Just what we needed and fun too.  Will go back! Yay!

You've got to be kidding me.....

My parents just moved to the Cave Creek area and so we went for a visit. I figured if we are going to the sticks, might as well go all out and hit an authentic southwestern place, so I made reservations at Tonto. 

The decor is definitely southwestern but way over the top cheesy southwestern. 

The food is, well...., the food is just not good.
I've never and I do mean never gone to a place where every meal picked at the table was bad. Pork Schnitzel is not really schnitzel, more of a poorly breaded piece of pork cut up into triangle slices and it was extremely tough. Spring Pea Risotto had the consistency of paste, Diver Scallops did not taste fresh and the Calamari on my Mother's salad was like rubber. 

And finally the service, what can I say other than the service just flat out sucks.
Waitress had some kind of piss poor attitude. I would have been better off asking the floor tiles to serve us. 

Not going to beat around the bush and give 3 or 2 stars saying I will give it another try because that ain't gonna happen.
Best Unique Southwestern Upscale Restaurant and Golf Golf Course View in Cave Creek !

Wow, very impressed. With the spa and golf course on site it would be easy to assume quality mass production meals that are good but not real good, typically predictable but NOT HERE! This is excellent scratch made food. Great choices rich in flavor. Good service, great atmosphere, good view and really not too busy. It gets full but not like it might down south. Hidden gem.

After a week in North Scottsdale we found Tontos' and decided it was the best spot we had tried.  Loved the classic old western decor and atmosphere and the food was the most interesting we had in the area. The short ribs were amazing and served with the stacked sweet potato dish made for an awesome meal. My husband had the German pork snitzle with warm potato salad.  Was a little leery about ordering a classic German dish in old west type of restaurant but he said it was the best he had ever had. Inside, or out on the lovely patio, a charming place to spend the evening!  Look forward to going again on my next trip to the desert.

Dinner was a great experience for all four of us.  I wish I had noted the name of the bartender, she was incredibly nice and very helpful before we sat for dinner.  The food was very well prepared.  We ordered the guacamole appetizer which comes with both corn and flour tortilla and fry bread and two three salsas, great presentation on that and all the food.  I wish the salsa had more heat, but that was just me.  My wife had the salmon, just about perfect, and I had the New York Strip which was a very flavorful but tender steak.  Based on other reviews, we sat outside and actually ended up a little cold, also very little to see because we were there quite late.  I'd like to come back and eat more at around twilight or during the day.

Have been there twice in the past few months.  First time was during the busier snow bird season.  My wife and I were seated quickly.  Order was taken and then they forgot about us.  Tables next to us got their food quickly but ours never came.  Spoke to the manager who offered to quickly make our entrees but we left since we had somewhere to go.  Tried it again about 3 weeks ago.   It was not busy but the service was again terrible.  We wanted to order drinks but could not get the attention of our server who was standing at the ending of the room talking to the other servers.  We finally had to ask one of the busboys.  Our food came relatively quickly.  My wife ordered a hamburger.  It was so greasy that the bun was saturated with grease and not edible.  We complained to the manager who offered to bring her another.  We decided to leave after finishing the appetizers. Would not go back.  It is unfortunate since we live  min away and would love to have a good neighborhood place.

My husband came in at 8:50 on a friday night. Place was full. we were hopeful it was going to be a great dinner! Hostess, a young girl turned us away and said they had stopped serving dinner! If owner knew they would be furious!  W edrove another thirty minutes to Mortons Steak House where we spent $300.00 and were treated like Kings. Too bad.

Beautiful venue overlooking the golf course, with upscale southwestern décor and good food.....best burgers in the area!
Sitting outside on the patio at the end of the day watching the sun go down is a treat.
Great service! Food was great. However, lost one star though because food bill was comparable to Ruth's Chris steakhouse but the quality of food was not on par with the price we paid.

We visit this restaurant annually.  I ordered the jalapeño corned beef sandwich with sweet potato tots, which I lived in the past.  The sandwich was skimpy with two slices of fatty corned beef, little cheese and too much sauerkraut.  The tots were overcooked with burnt edges.  I was insulted that they served this food and expected a hefty cost.  This is the last time we visit this restaurant.

Ate here with friends from Scottsdale. Very southwestern ranchy vibe. Sat on covered heated patio but could not appreciate view in the dark. Very accommodating service. Customized meal for my food restrictions. Fresh homemade bread was very good. Grilled salmon a bit mushy. Deconstructed creme brulee was yummy.

I am just going to tell you to go to happy hour.  Bartender was adorable as were the other patrons seated at the bar.  Beautiful spot in Cave Creek.  I guess I need to go for a meal for a full review.  But go have a cocktail.

Stopped by here on the way back from Cave Creek Stables. The decor was great but the ambience was a bit flat (people must eat early lunch because at 1:30pm, the place was dead). 

Service was very fast and portions were good. Only issue is that they completely messed up our order and gave my wife the gluten free option instead of the vegan (so the salad had cheese when she is lactose intolerant). Otherwise the food was good.
We took some friends to Tonto Grill and they absolutely love it and so did we. Great food, wonderful server and good drinks. Do yourself a favor and give this place a try!

Basically this place really need to justify its prices. Ive been all over the country, and visited different parts of the world, spent years on the French Riviera, and cant figure out why this place is so expensive.

Nothing on the menu was perfect. I had to get my order custom made, and left kind of disappointed. The overall quality was pretty good, but I was expecting to discover something amazing, or at least win a cash prize.

Decor was typical "Spanish Style", which they probably didnt have to spent a lot on since thats what all the places in the area are like, except the track homes and the strip malls.

So what I am asking Tonto Bar, is for you to give me a reason to come back. Also, keep in mind that I am vegetarian.
The food here is great and sitting outdoors during the nicer weather is a great experience!

The food and service have seriously gone downhill at this restaurant, which used to be a favorite. The service was make-believe good--server circled solicitously, but our food arrived congealed and cold. The short ribs, which I've had here before, were small, fatty and greasy, covered with mystery gravy, and hideously overpriced for bad cafeteria-style food. Don't come here for the food.

They took off the blt, make you pay for bread, and the salads got smaller. Dang it. We used to come here at least once a month. Love the views and the service is always amazing. Just a little bummed! All of the good places end of going down hill due to cost.
Lovely setting and very delicious and unusual menu items   The tacos o had were super yummy. I have heard the corn chowder is delicious and will try it next time

Hostess was not inviting. Seated us on the patio in direct sun when many seats were open in the shade. I requested to be moved but it seemed to be an inconvenience. The staff seemed like they didn't want to be there. Good food but for the price management needs to focus on training their employees. Particularly the hostess. First impressions are everything.

I was so very disappointed today at lunch.  I have been here several times and had great service.  I was surprised today to have a server that couldn't have cared less about our service.  He was very curt when we questioned him about menu items etc. At one point he turned his head and rolled his eyes in my direction.   After we finished our meal I heard that there was a lunch special....why weren't we told about it??  I asked him about the special and he said oh sorry I forgot to tell you.    We sat for 30-40 minutes with empty glasses of water.  We had to ASK for everything??  We just all felt like his lack of attention was very distasteful.
   Now on the other hand the food as always was good!!  I would have liked to have had the fish and chips.. we will be back because I feel this is an isolated incident but he needs some customer training.

This is a favorite whenever I come to Arizona to visit my family.  The view is fantastic and the food even better.  The waitstaff and is always friendly and helpful and puts up with my dad's antics (aka really bad jokes)  On my last visit I had the ahi tuna rolls and practically the whole bread basket by myself.  I also had the rioja wine.  Everything was delicious!  The weather cooperated and we were able to enjoy outside dining in the relaxed atmosphere and watch the wildlife on the golf course and the mountains in the background.  I can't recommend Tonto Bar and Grill enough.

Love, love, love Tonto.  Just had the sand dabs . . . never ever had sand dabs before . . .  ridiculously delicious!!!

On a wickedly busy night, with private parties in the main rooms and patios, Tonto still delivered with excellent service and great food!  It is my "go to" restaurant when we have company from out of town!

My friend and I discovered Tonto B & G while on a shopping excursion to Cave Creek.  Tonto reminds me of the La Quinta Resort in California except a lot cozier.  The retro Mexican/Arizona vibe is awesome and the menu was interesting.  The BLT sandwich was HUGE and the sweet potato tater tots were awesome.  The shrimp tacos were also tasty and a light way to enjoy lunch. Can't wait to return for an evening cocktail followed by dinner.

Beautiful place with great food. They have a separate vegan menu which is awesome but make sure to ask for it because not everything on it is on the regular menu.  Service was great and the food was super flavorful!

We had lunch here and it was very good. The corn chowder was phenomenal. The view was amazing. Definitely recommend sitting outside if possible.  Our lunch was fabulous. Our service experience was great.
Time for a menu change. Food is good, service great. At some point new items would be positive
Terrible service from one of the managers. Long brown hair with glasses. Do not recommend for the service but the food is outstanding and the lower patio is breathtaking.
Today I'm having the corned beef hash and like always good service great scenery and great company great resort to

This is my favorite restaurant! The food is always great. The southwestern influence is subtle. The indoor space is gorgeous but we prefer eating outside. The views are stunning. Please dust the outdoor fans & light fixtures! The wood repairs should be next.

Love the atmosphere,  quaint.  Patio lovely, nice view of golf course.  Service was good.  Problem for us, way over priced.   Prime Rib sandwich,  $14...it was tasty, but very little meat.  Salmon dinner guest liked, price fair.   But $12  for house wine and $10 for draft beer, too pricey.  For 4 of us two drinks a piece averaged $40 a piece including tip. Giving 3 stars for over all experience.
Our weekly jaunt. I love the place and the Caesar is fabulous especially with a side of anchovies. The seasonal soups are a must. Scenery inside and out fabulous.

After avoiding this place for some time After bed experience about one year ago, decided to give thus place another chance and ...... If you like late 80's beginning 90's cooking with mediocre service you may like this place
A lovely place for an outdoor lunch.  Good food and very pleasant setting on a golf course.

Hi All,
Since my review last march, I am pleased to say that the Tonto improved significantly. 

My wife and I  tend to frequent the facility every 7-10 days and the food quality has improved 100%. 
We have not had a disappointing meal and the service is excellent again...

So.. all who read this I suggest you get down to the Tonto in Cave Creek, they are back as the Number 1 eatery in Cave Creek..

WELL DONE

I will Never go back.  The only redeeming thing about this place was the view.
The food was Sub~par.  The service was poor... The margaritas weren't even good.
It was maybe 3:30pm on a Sunday afternoon. It was not even a busy time.
With so many places to choose from why spend$$$$

We've dined here four times now and it keeps getting better. The beef tenderloin is so tender and the bacon wrapped shrimp are huge! Huge! I love the prickly pear margaritas and we always get dessert no matter how stuffed we are already. The warm chocolate buttermilk cake is like a souffle and comes with a little cup of chocolate sauce to pour on top. That's awesome.
Tonto's consistently offers a great overall experience. Food is always prepared well, atmosphere is nice and service excellent. John and Cody do a really nice job.

Very disappointed in lunch today at Tonto Bar & Grill.  I ordered the entree size Tonto Salad with added avocado, thinking it would be a knockout given the Tonto name, and my dining mate ordered the Reuben with sweet potato tater tots.  The Reuben was very good - generous serving size, nicely grilled, and served warm.  My entree Tonto Salad was also served warm, very small for an entree serving size, and overly coated in dressing making the butter lettuce soggy and limp.  The salad consists of sliced horse radish, halved cherry tomatoes, and sunflower seeds, all of which were very, very scarce. I was charged an extra $2 for the avocado which I'm happy to pay but it consisted of two slices placed on top, perhaps 1/8 of a whole avocado. Service was very good but server should have been embarrassed to serve the Tonto Salad. We are fans of Tonto and Cartwright's but won't be returning to Tonto anytime soon.
The food here is stellar. The ambiance and views are wonderful. The service is the best in town. This time round we had the scallops and the sand dabs, both were very  enjoyable.

I really enjoy going to this restaurant. It is located on a golf course and resort. The restaurant is decorated and a Spanish style with a rustic feel. The food is really good. I had a salad but it was really fresh with avocado and yummy chicken. They have these rolls that are pretty bummed too. Give this place a try for sure.

The last time I was here might have before Yelp existed!  I was always a big fan and was looking forward to my first visit since 2009.  What I positively recalled from my last visit was the Tonto burger, the great views of the mountains nearby and the calming ambience of Cave Creek.  All of those recollections were confirmed along with a great dessert of a coconut lemon tart with a couple of chocolate chip biscottis for dessert. If you need an escape from the Valley hustle and bustle and have some time for a great evening, Tonto Grill is the place to head.

We had a late lunch here after a round of golf.  We had heard that the restaurant is superior and the dishes re interesting.  We were not disappointed.  The interior and exterior of the restaurant are so appealing in different ways.  Inside it is rustic with lots of wood; very warm and inviting.  The outside patio is on the golf course and is so pleasant. Its two tiered so everyone has a great view of what's happening on the course.  We both had corn chowder which was fantastic.  My husband had a Reuben on that he really enjoyed.  It was very large so he took half home.  The French fries are the kind that are very crunchy.  They must dust them with something.  I had a Caesar salad which was not to exciting but nothing really wrong with it.  The wait staff and hostess was friendly and efficient and the space was spotless.  We would definitely come back.

Ate at Tonto Bar and Grill for Valentines dinner 2016. The southwestern theme throughout the restaurant is done in beautiful taste and the backdrop of the golf course makes eating here magical. We will be back again!

Food is very good and service is good. Great place for lunch but beware it is very highly priced. However the quality is there, just doesn't seem like a place that is so expensive when you first sit.  So savor it if you go!

If you have not dined here before, it is a must. It is one of my favorite restaurants in cave creek and the state for that matter! The atmosphere and menu is very unique and the service is always great. I love that it's not your average chain restaurant. When it's good weather, you can dine outside and have views of the golf course. Definitely make a reservation because it's very popular and gets busy, especially on the weekends. If you love it here, you can try their sister restaurant up the road called Cartwrights. Similar southwestern menu but a little fancier.

Love Tonto Bar and Grill but disappointed that they changed their Happy Hour. You might as well just enjoy their dinners for almost the same price. They used to have $5.00 drinks and apps. Now they take a couple of dollars off their regular prices. No real HH any more.
One of the things I love about this establishment is they consistently have fantastic food every time I go. Very creative and the location is beautiful. Don't miss their prickly pear margarita.

We had a large and very excited party (with reservations) and the entire experience could not have been nicer! The servers explained things (to us easterners) several times and were superior with special orders and a few substitutions. No water glass was ever unfilled (we even spilled one and they were right on the spot to clean it up). We divided the check between two families and they were happy to do it - and they were accurate! The food was great (I had the chicken and creamed corn) and it was plenty to eat, well-seasoned and piping hot - not easy to do with that many people in the group. I'd recommend the restaurant to anyone - even though the resort it was in didn't look like it was doing too well.

Even in the off-season, the restaurant was full and we ate fairly early (6:30). Tasty, reasonably priced for vactioners, and a lovely event.

I had a dinner here with friends. The menu is varied, with everything from soups, burgers, and steaks and chicken. I had the burger, it was OK but in my opinion, a bit on the expensive side, even for the location. Same for the soup. Average to slightly above average food, at much greater than average prices. I probably wouldn't go again.
Had a really lovely lunch on the patio. Great service, dog friendly, delicious gluten free options, especially the GF bread basket.

The brunch menu screams assembly breakfast with no toast or substitutions. Maybe it was too early but seemed we were the only people there. The serving crew was over staffed and untrained creating many useless interactions and hapless attempts at service because they had no short term memory. Beautiful place but needs just a few professionals to make it a goldmine. The manager was worthless. I feel sorry for the kids she hires.

If I could give Tonto 50 STARS.... I would! We just had dinner there Sat..(9/5) and it was beyond Perfection.... from the phone call to make the reservation, table by the window, exceptional service.... and the Food~. . .Best Dinner we had had in a long time~~ 1/2 the price of  Bourbon Steak.. 10 times the flavor and Value..... can't wait to go back  many times~!!.Thank you so much to the entire Staff.... and the Bar is very nice~!!!

After hearing about this restaurant from watching reviews on channel 8, my husband and I decided to take a drive to cave reek for lunch and check this place out! We had an excellent lunch on the patio and got to watch golfers too! It was a fantastic lunch and we will be coming here again soon!! I would definitely recommend this restaurant for lunch or dinner!!

We had dinner in the old room next to the Bar area.  The food was fine but the service was pretty painful.  It was one of those dinners where to get the next thing we had to flag down our server or someone else.  I ordered a cocktail and waited almost 15 minutes for it to arrive.  We had to ask for bread and for the cocktail glass to be removed and for another wine glass to be brought and we had to ask for several other things as well.  It is hard to enjoy dinner and company when you are waving at servers all the time.

We have been going to Tonto Bar & Grill for nearly 20 years. It has always been one of the places we take all of our visitors. Our tab as a couple is always close to $100 (including wine) and we don't begrudge the price. One small thing has been bugging me from our last few visits. In the past, the bread basket was complimentary but now they charge $3-$4 for it. The excuse that I was given was that they had too much wasted bread. So rather than make the bread basket complementary "upon request" (like Zinc Bistro) Tonto is charging for it. It seems like management was just looking for another revenue opportunity...not what I would expect from an upscale restaurant when I'm spending a "Benjamin".

Tonto Bar & Grill has been a place I have frequented many times.
I have taken clients there, out of town visitors and my wife!
The food is always excellent.
And the view of the golf course is just breathtaking. 

But last week I decided on a whim to grab dinner there, as my family was away, and I was driving by.
As I was on my own, I decided to sit at the bar.

Wow! What a great evening. Met the barkeeper, Brittany, as well as another couple that was eating there. It felt like I was with family. Despite the fact that Brittany was serving us, as well as all the other waiters, she still found time to chat, and keep us amused. 

The fillet was, as to be expected, awesome! And the evening went by like a flash.

I eat out a lot, as I travel all the time. I will be eating there more often in the future.

Tonto was excellent from start to finish! I can't wait to return!!! We visited for restaurant week and had a great experience. We made a reservation and were seated right away. I ordered the tortilla crusted crab cakes for an appetizer and my Hubby had the salad. The crab cakes were sooooo yummy and tasty! The roasted chile slaw was a perfect pairing for that added crunch and the flavor of the chipotle aioli topped everything off. Hubby's Harvest salad was very good as well and all the flavors worked very well together. For the main course I had the Ancho chili rubbed filet with asparagus and Manchego scalloped potatoes, which were to die for!!! Hubby had the orange barbecued salmon. He really enjoyed this dish!!! Served with spaghetti squash and a sweet potato hash. Flavors meshed very well there. Dessert was the icing on the cake. Hubby had the chocolate cake with a butter pecan ice cream and I had the lemon lime merengue pie. YUMMMMMM. Both were extremely good and we savored every bite :) also tried their chocolate kiss coffee desert drink which was excellent. We give this place two thumbs up!! Definitely will return.

We were out there for brunch today and the food was exceptional.  Due to food allergies, they helped accommodate me, even though they had a set menu for Easter. I hate being "that" person at the table, but our server was so sweet and helpful.  We were a party of 4 with an infant, and even when I walked around with my granddaughter, everyone was so friendly. Thank you for a wonderful brunch experience!  I would love to try your normal menu, so we'll be back.

Beautiful golf course view. Corn chowder delicious. Burgers and tacos ok.  Margarita just ok too. Not much taste. So glad there was a special menu for our gluten free person. She usually has to ask so many questions.  Have to pay for bread.  We did have a beautiful day and good table with an umbrella. Lunch time. Kinda wish I hadn't made our group go, but you never know. It's a 3.

My family and I went for lunch and we all loved every bite!  The flavors were amazing!  I had the shrimp tacos and didn't expect it to be so good.  I'm from Chicago where the restaurants are so much better than the typical boring, flavorless chains you find everywhere here. Something so little as the fries where outstanding - even when cold!  Our server was very professional and pleasant who told us the restaurant has been around for 21 years!  It must be doing something right.  The ambiance was relaxing and warm - upscale casual and very rustic.  Lunch was pricey but well worth it.  I'd rather spend extra for a memorable meal than waste it on mediocre bland food that I can make better at home. 

A great place for a date night, clients, out of town guests or just when you want a wonderful meal. One of my favorite restaurants and will be back!

Went to dinner on a Friday night and not many customers due to being off-season in the valley! The water server was by far the best staff member of all! The waitress was short and felt rushed with no one in the restaurant! When we had finished eating she came to the table and said "menus" we looked up and was like what?!?! She then said "menu, coffee" I answered the check please, and she just walked off....I am not sure 100% but I think that was her desert pitch?!?! Please train your staff to wait tables! 

The food is ok, not great but ok, the pricing does not even warrant the quality of food, even for a the area! 

If you are a tourist go to other places in the area and I am sure you will have a much more enjoyable experience for your money! Please train your kitchen staff to simply steam vegetables!!
That was awesome!  BLT and a Sam Adams on a beautiful day.  Sat outside looking over the golf course and it was absolutely wonderful!

My Wife picked this spot for her Birthday dinner. Great choice! Never even heard of this place before. Now, part of the 5 star experience has to do with a few intangibles that were beyond their control: Weather was perfect, about 80 degrees. I'm usually not a big fan of dining Al Fresco (outdoors), but this evening was just perfect. They have a very nice patio for dining, overlooking the sunset, cacti, and a golf course. No bugs, no excessive heat, no wind...All things that can spoil a Desert Dining Experience.

Food was fantastic. She had crab cakes as an appetizer, I had a beet salad with greens, goat cheese, and vinaigrette dressing. Entrees were filet mignon with au gratin 'taters, and I had a braised short rib in a root beer sauce, french green beans, and a squash side dish... Both veggies were excellent. Dessert came with our prix fixe meal, and they made a swell Birthday cake ensemble for her, and I had a relish creme brûlée that was perfect.

I definitely will return to this place, as I saw people ordering (southwestern) hamburgers with sweet potato tater tots, for about 12 bucks. Looked great.

Service was really professional, not overly friendly, just spot on. This would be a great place to take out of towners to experience a Southwestern dining experience. Near perfect!

OOOHHH I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! FIrst you drive through beautiful Cave Creek, Arizona!! The surrounding mountains are so gorgeous. The views are breathtaking! You stop at Rancho Maniana and there is a Restaurant at the Golf Course and it's the best!!! The atmosphere is gorgeous and the food is delectible! The food is mouth-watering in every bite! This place is a "must see" on our list every time we visit Arizona! (almost every year!). They have "different" menu items than some other places and some of your every day type of things also. They have an outdoor patio that has marvelous mountain views and the golfcourse of course! Their desserts are special and yummy and their main dishes are always made with the best and most delicious foods!

I chose Tonto for my birthday dinner and my husband reserved a table in the patio. When we got there, they attempted to seat us inside. We said we had reserved the patio. They looked again & seated us at the "cocktail" patio. This is NOT the nice patio and our plans to eat dinner while we watched the sunset and overlooked the golf course were over. This patio is on the side and has no view whatsoever and seemed to be for bar overflow. Our waitress was fine but we were clearly being rushed through our courses. Our entire meal (appetizer, salad, entree & dessert) was over in an hour. We've had better paced meals at Chili's. We spent more time in the car coming & going than we did eating. The food itself was just ok. We spoke to both managers and neither seemed all that apologetic though one finally comped our app & dessert. They had so many opportunities to make it right and never did. I doubt we'd ever go back and I honestly can't think of one reason we would.

This restaurant has it all. Attentive staff, fabulous food and ambiance like no other in Cave Creek.  In particular, the split pea soup is the best I've ever had. Omg. It is so delicious that I can't go there without ordering it. It is just that good! The desserts are beautiful and decadent and you can tell that they've just been freshly made. Wow. This to me defines the perfect restaurant. Lovely.Delicious. and guaranteed to make your day.

Cave Creek is my favorite little town. It makes me so so happy! We've vacationed at Rancho Mañana many times throughout the years and Tonto Bar and Grill brings back all the happy memories with consistently good food over the decades. They have the best staff, quality food, allergy-aware and those views!!!

I wish I could give Tonto Bar and Grill a 5 star, but I just can't do it...

My fiance and I met some friends for dinner on Saturday night.  The property was gorgeous, the ambiance was perfection, the server was delightful, and the food was amazing... 

The real problem was management.  

As we settled in to a nice quiet dinner, a family was seated behind us and soon after, the child began to screach.  And screach.  And screach.   The bone chilling, eardrum piercing kind of screach.  

My fiance asked the manager to move us, but I REALLY think the manager should have moved the family or asked them to take their little one outside.   I would have expected the parents to be courteous enough to think of that for themselves, but that's not the world we live in apparently.  

Anyway, we were moved to the smaller, less comfortable dining room, however, we could STILL hear that child screaching from the other side of the building over and over again throughout the evening. 

Probably half dozen or more tables were also moved from the larger, nicer dining room and away from the inconsiderate family during the time we were there.  So, basically, the rude family got a "private" dining room with a view while all the other paying customers had to be relocated.  

This was extremely disappointing!!!   If I am going to be pay $80+ for my meal, I definitely expect better!    We were hoping to come back when the weather turns nice to enjoy the outdoor patio, but now I am not so sure it's worth the risk..

Hmm..I had high hopes with the other reviews on this restaurant. Great view of the golf course, but very disappointing on the food. However if you like your asparagus old & burnt..this is the place for you! 

In all fairness, the server did offer to replace the asparagus, but at this point I had already waited 40 mins for my meal. Not to mention a simple request like no croutons on the salad couldn't even be followed either.

Ummmm,  just ok... Started with salsa guac platter for table / good. Guac was watered down with salsa and had chunks of jicama in it. Was good but not for everyone.

One of the BEST PARTS OF MEAL -I started with the "harvest" salad with no protein added.  This was GREAT BY ITSELF... The perfect blend of flavors. The sweetness of the fruit and the bite of the vinaigrette  finished by the sweet and creamy of the cheese and salty of the nuts.  

 BUZZ KILL- For my main course I ordered the honey bbq salmon on spaghetti squash and sweet potato.   At the recommendation of many yelpers.  I Asked for sauces on side, as I am very sensitive to salt and sauces have a lot of sodium hidden in them not to mention the xtra calories.  The salmon was not fishy but was very very salty almost as if it was if it was soaked in salt water.  A trick restaurants do with frozen fish to hide the fact the fish is not fresh or to hide fishy flavors.  NOT GOOD PEOPLE!!!!!

The SAVING GRACE and WORTH THE TRIP TO TONTO!!!!

The SOUR CREAM LEMON LIME CHEESECAKE!!!!

Can I get A SUPERFREAKINGRAJALISTICLICKYOURPLATE GOOD!!!!  I was in a TRANCE NO ONE TALK TO ME SO GOOD GOOD!!!!!

Made me forget about the other issues for a little bit.  But not long enough to NOT WRITE A REVIEW... Sorry TONTO but you need help!!

Shared the cheesecake with a few other people and kinda wish I had my own.

I live in Desert Hills and I always forget about this place.  Thanks to Restaurant Week, we went there again and it was delicious.  We were starting to suspect the bartender had some sort of time travel machine because our drinks arrived nearly at the same moment we ordered them.  Our meals were tasty and the service was great.  Beautiful setting.

Based on other reviews, we decided to try it. So glad we did! We sat out on the patio overlooking the golf course. Great setting. My husband had the organic burger, he said it was one of the best he's ever had. I had the Tumbleweed salad with calamari on top. The calamari was cooked perfectly; not tough or chewy. All the staff was delightful. Will return if we're ever in the area again.

If you don't want Indian fry bread or a biker bar or spending big bucks at the boulders.
I guess you come to this establishment.
Kinda loud, food is generic Southwestern fare.
A pile of people congratulate here..
  Like sheep to water I guess

This is my husband and my favorite restaurant up here in Cave Creek. I think more than half the draw is the view. While I choose to live in the desert and love it, there is something distinctly calming - and cooling - about looking out over a vista of green. Watch long enough and you'll see javelina and possibly bobcats and mountain lions out on the gold course. The menu says it changes seasonally but I haven't really noticed a change in the last year. Not a huge selection of food but nicely edited - try the two pasta dishes, which are our favorites. Service from the waitstaff is great, but I took a star away for the hostesses. They're all like 16 years old, never, ever smile or make you feel welcome and have proven to be utterly unhelpful when asked even something as simple as how long the wait would be. We've also called ahead to reserve a specific table, told it wold be held for us & had this little blond cheerleader tell us too bad, so sad, not her problem. I always kind of steel myself for those initial couple of minutes, but once seated it's a wonderful experience. Just wish they would hire grownups to man the front.

Had the chance to Tonto Bar & Grill thanks to some friends in Cave Creek who have been here before and suggested it!  We just enjoyed the patio, happy hour and the fire place.

I didn't eat, but a desert was shared by the girls and they loved it!  The atmosphere is classic desert!

I've eaten here three times in the last three years with a ladies lunch group,and s book club.  Nothing to write hone about..hum drum food,nice service and great views. They can accommodate large crowds

Great ambience, especially on the patio, great waitress who has very attentive and nice. My girlfriend and I both had the salmon and it was damn good. Tons of flavors dancing around, from sweet to spicy (but not too spicy).  All around, a really great experience.

I ate lunch here today and it was really fantastic! Besides an extensive regular menu, Tonto has a vegan and gluten free menu...yummmm. I started with the caprese salad which had three fresh mozzarellas (ancho chili, sage, hibiscus) made on site paired with three thick slices of heirloom tomato and micro sage. My cousin suggested their spaghetti squash (a side) to share and it was delicious! It is seasoned with grilled onion and tossed with wilted spinach...so good! My meal was a torta with layers of mashed anasazi beans, green chiles, chopped tomatoes, mashed sweet potatoes and a bunch of other stuff and was accompanied by whole grain baked crackers. It was a great blend of textures in the torta and all the flavors mixed seamlessly. My cousin had an ahi tuna roll that looked like it had been covered in tempura - she loved it. 

The flavors of everything we tried really stood out. I would go back in a second!
Yummy - you  can't go wrong.  The atmosphere is beautiful and the food is great!

Food and ambience is still great, and the original review still stands after 10 or so more visits, but the salads have shrunk to about 1/4 the size previous which is so disappointing. An entree salad is no longer enough for a meal so the value just isn't there. After 3 disappointing and paltry salads, I'll be ordering other items.

Played the awesome golf course (shot 85) and had lunch outside on the patio. Everything was delicious and satisfying. The Tonto-ritas were refreshing and the white shrimp tacos to die for. The avocado crema served on the side was a perfect compliment to the ancho chili sauce on the shrimp n veggies. My wife and I visit this area once a year to spend time with family and I cannot wait to go back!
Yum!! Go for happy hour and sunset. Everything is great, skip the salads. Nothing like the actual meals. And great dessert choices too.

We sat outside on a beautiful evening which is always a good start to a dinner with friends. The drink list was adequate and the wines by the glass satisfactory. The calimari appetizer was excellent. The squash soup and corn chowder were wonderful. My wife really enjoyed her pasta. I was excited to see veal liver but the preparation disappointed me and the vegetables were not very flavorful. Service was excellent: good waitress with a trainee and a busboy who was attentive. This is a favorite of our friends. I m not sure it is great but we did have a good meal with good service.

My husband and I ate here recently and both enjoyed the Short Ribs- excellent flavor and the sweet potato casserole was amazing. I also had a Prickly Pear Margarita which was excellent. It was very busy on a Saturday night and loud, but we sat on the patio which was very nice and heaters were running to keep us warm. All in all, great place for food and drinks!

Hubby and I stopped in for an early dinner after a great round of golf, celebrating a very special "90-degree-on-June-11th-day" in the valley!!!

Seriously, when can us locals enjoy a beautiful outdoor patio with such a stunning view in June?!!! We had to properly celebrate!

We had great service, from the hostess to the runners and server! Everyone was terrific and the food was the highlight!  Every bite was a delight of flavors, and we can't wait to come back and try other dishes from such a creative menu!

They even had a choice between two non-alcoholic beers, properly poured in a frosted glass at our table. I don't know why, but it's pretty common that beer without alcohol somehow gets treated less-than at most places. Strange, but true!

Bon appetit!

We will travel many miles to go to a good restaurant - including an overnight trip to Tucson or a weekend in Santa Fe. 
We have been meaning to try the TBG, but due to very inconsistent reviews, we had put it off. 
"Inconsistent" defines our experience at TBG this week. 
Worthy of 5 stars: 
The location, decor, view, and ambiance. 
Our server was also attentive and friendly. 
Our drinks were great also. 
Atmosphere: We were lucky enough to sit on the patio at dusk. The golf course/mountain/saguaro view was stunning. A small herd of javelina even ambled their way across the course. 
Worthy of 2 stars: 
Menu: I thought it was fairly boring from the beginning. No signature dishes or anything very unique. It would have made sense to have something Southwestern. 
Because of the golf course, I do understand the need for more casual sandwich offerings, however. 

We each had a cup of corn chowder - something  I love. It was served sloppily with a puddle of soup under the bowl and I could clearly see where someone had attempted to wipe soup off the saucer (a smear the width of a finger). 
The soup was average - very little corn, potatoes in large chunks too big for a cup of soup, and it could have used more flavor. (Some roasted poblano). 
I had the Tumbleweed salad with chicken. Just an average salad. Even the dressing wasn't that great. 
My husband had the Root Beer braised Short Ribs. 
We both felt the reduced flavor of the root beer was just too distractingly sweet. (Have no clue why they would then choose sweet potatoes as an accompaniment). 
In summary, we really wanted to love this place and again admired the setting as we left. We agreed that if we ever come back - it would be just for drinks, appetizer, and to enjoy the patio. 
They really need to up their game on the food!
This is our favorite place for dinner at sunset.  Beautiful view and great food.  We have been going here for 15 yrs.  Never disappointed

I have come here several times since it is so close to my house.  During restaurant week, we decided to invite some friends to experience this place. This year it was $40 per person which is ok for the location.  We had not been here in a while.  The location is pretty nice and if the day is beautiful, you can enjoy dinner in their beautiful patio.  To start I had the beet salad and my hubby had the crab cakes, those were delicious, I wish I had chosen that.  I love beets, but my salad was not as great as I have had before.  For our entree I had the salmon and the hubby had the filet, those two dishes were amazing.  On the other hand, the desserts were underwhelming.  I prefer the dessert from the regular menu, specially the sticky caramel meringue terrine, yum.  If you go for lunch or dinner, the hamburgers and salads are HUGE.  An how can I forget my guilty pleasure, the bread basket has little corn bread muffins, those are the bomb, I could eat a dozen.  No wonder my pants are a little tighter now.
We sat out on the patio and it was a great atmosphere. The drinks and food were delicious!

Great food, impeccable service, beautiful surroundings. Their menu has enough southwestern touches to add culinary interest but not too much to make the food too powerful or overwhelming with the spices. Have been going here for 10 years and still is my favorite for lunch or dinner in the Town of Cave Creek. My only complaint is that they stopped serving their jalapeño rolls this year, MUST get them back! 
I used Open Table app online to make my reservation and it was perfect!

The menu offers variety of dishes covering from Southwest, TexMex, All American,  etc.  Quite tasty on the items I have tried thus far and the service is good to excellent. Their veal liver was superb.

Atmosphere is quite nice, if you are seating outdoor patio area as you get to see the golf course.
Delicious food, great outdoor patio. Wonderful cocktail menu. Not a huge selection for vegetarians but definitely doable.

Southwestern ambiance, small gem!!  Tucked in, next to the golf course with indoor and patio seating.   Ranch/Hacienda decor with an awesome intimate bar.  Two for lunch today!  BLT and Ruben sandwiches with side salads were very generous in portions.  Probably the best BLT for me; fried tomatoes and thick sliced bacon with brioche toast.  The Ruben was equally as good.  Everything was fresh and we'll assembled and made.  The house made Salted Caramel gelto was, well...delightful.   A return spot from now on, and will bring guests.

We were pleasantly by the ambiance, view of the 11th hole and the surrounding area and the friendly staff. We had just finished a very long 18 holes and went to the restaurant at roughly 4:30 for a very early dinner.It almost felt like lunch it was so darn early! Service was very attentive so that we had enough time to review the extensive menu with very many delicious sounding items on it. We both ordered soup - a creamy yet light textured four mushroom blend with deep mushroom flavor, the corn one was tasty yet needed a little bit of spice to bring up the flavor. 

The buffalo chicken sandwich was the bomb. A crispy and brown, beer batter fried boneless chicken breast nestled between a moist pretzel bun, blue cheese crumbles and a ranch dressing/aïoli. Spicy buffalo sauce was on the side so as to not make the crisp chicken soggy. That's when you know the chef knows what they're doing. OMG - super delicious!  

The shrimp tacos where also amazing. White shrimp cooked with peppers and a spicy red sauce and served in a hot little cauldron - actually a mini molcajete. The tortillas were good and as I filled and made my own tacos I was amazed that I had enough filling for all of the tortillas. At last count it was at least 20 shrimp and these were not tiny ones, they were of the approximate 31 to 40 count size, so there was about half a pound of shrimp (before cooking) in this order. Very good value. The cilantro sour cream sauce that came with them was very tasty with a good hit of cilantro and garlic flavor. 

The chocolate cake which was supposed to be one of those molten types was overcooked and did not have a soft center, but it had good flavor.

Good beers, decent wine choices and very nice service.

So disappointed last night.  One of our favorite places. Food is still consistently good however service( not our server) was so fast we could not enjoy our meal.  Entree arrived while we were still eating appetizer.   Tried to clear table while I still had fork in my hand. When it came time to leave we couldn't find anyone to tell about our experience.  This does not reflect on our server but the kitchen and other staff.  So sad. This is not the first time this has happened there.  Doubt we will ever go back.

This is one of our favorite restaurants in cave creek. The views from the patio are breathtaking even if you don't play golf. I can't even decide what I like best about the menu. Drinks, wine, appetizers, dessert and everything in between is consistently good. Even when we've had an unexpected problem with a dish they have always been quick to make things right. They have a pretty decent happy hour. It's a kid friendly resort but I've heard on other sites that you might want to leave your baby at home. That's ok with me because it's a fairly romantic place and I'd rather your kid not ruin my date night. Other than that, go there.

After scoping out this place online I was pretty excited to try it out and impress some friends with the expansive Vegetarian and gluten-free menus I saw online. We didn't meet there until after dark - and dark it was. We were seated outside where luckily the heaters were going, but there were no lights to show off the golf course - which, I do get given conservation of many means, but it was a bit disappointing nonetheless. It was just dinner outside on a chilly night next to a dark abyss. I guess the key is to make a reservation or make sure you can wait around for an inside table. 

The waitress was friendly, almost a bit overly so but still very nice.

The food was a disappointment for the non-vegetarians. My husband and I each had a burger expecting them to be amazing (they usually are at fancy golf courses) but no, we were both very let down and unimpressed. The veggies that our friends had looked tasty and seemingly more enjoyable. I'm certainly not out in Cave Creek often, and we made the trek from Surprise (visiting fam for Thanksgiving) to give our guests a good experience. I honestly wouldn't recommend this place based on my visit. I'm still bummed over it!

We went here for lunch today and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.  The setting is spectacular right on the golf course with a beautiful view of the mountains.  The service is good.  And the food was really quite good.  I enjoyed the chorizo and potato quiche with a southwestern caesar salad and my husband enjoyed the steak sandwich - 3 medallions on a blue cheese bruschetta with green beans and potatoes.   All in all, a very relaxing and enjoyable lunch!

Was excited to check this place out. They sat us with a 2yr old and a 1yr old but no children's menu. When we asked our server if there were children's items she apologized and brought one but I heard the hostess lie and tell her we told her we didn't need one.  We were swatting at flies the whole time which was super annoying. And with the tables around us doing the same it was super distracting. Our server was nice and food quality was good except.....my wife pulled an 8 inch hair out of her sandwich! I waited until I paid the bill to let our server know about the hair so she knew I wasn't jacking around. Overall not impressed.

Will never be going back or recommending; rude hostess staff and poor reflection on Management.     

Upon arrival, the hostess wouldn't seat me on the patio because patrons wanting drinks were restricted to the inside bar area and the outside patio was for dinner reservation guests only.  I was shocked because it was 3:30 and many patio tables remained vacant - there was hardly anyone in the entire restaurant!!!   I even offered to order food and would gladly give up the table when they needed it for dinner but the hostess still refused to seat my parents and I outside.   Who turns away a customer willing to purchase alcohol and food + give you back a table for dinner guests?   The entire interaction with the hostess staff was rude and a poor reflection of the entire management.    My parents were in town visiting from Chicago and wanted to enjoy the warm weather sipping a cocktail on an outdoor patio.    I'll be drinking, eating, and enjoying a patio at another restaurant moving forward where they appreciate a repetitive patron.

I used to be a big fan of Tonto.  In particular, the salads and other vegetables were well-prepared and unlike other restaurants a great deal of care was taken to make the vegetables unique and tasty.  Sadly, that quality no longer seems as high.  Everything is still good, just not worth a unique trip.  Plus, it's kind of pricey given the level of food.

That said, there is nothing better than looking out from their patio while sitting in the sun.  Definitely, a five star setting.

4.5 stars, rating went down because our server, well, he wasn't good at all. Lack of customer appreciation and service. We had to tell him thank you, instead of him thanking us for coming in.

We were seated outside which was perfect because the weather was PERFECTION. Little drops of rain didn't stop us from eating a spectacular meal. We ordered the calamari, all rings, such flavor and delish. We also got ordered the Orange-Barbecued Salmon which had
sweet potato, poblano & grilled corn hash, spaghetti squash with spinach, roasted garlic & mesquite honey jus, TO DIE FOR! We also ordered the Root Beer-Braised Short Ribs
Boneless beef short ribs, sweet potato, caramelized onion and leek gratin, preserved
orange broccolini, again, everything melted in our mouths. The food was great, the service could be better!
A local favorite of mine in Cave Creek. The service is always good, and the food is on point. I just wish they would bring back the hummus app!

Poor food!  The Ruben sandwich used to be exceptional. Yesterday it was very disappointing. It was dry, no jalapeños and skimpy on the corned beef and sour kraut. 
My wife had the walleye that also used to be exceptional. Yesterday it was a complete joke as to the portion size of the fish.  It was literally smaller than what you get on a McDonald's fish sandwich. No exaggeration!  After complaining, the manager brought us another tiny piece of fish that was way undercooked. At this point we left and will not return.

Well, they removed the BLT, ( from the menu ) sad, ....at $9.50/ I expected a better "Bloody Mary"....the arugula salad was over dressed ( soggy )...I would like to see my scallops lightly bronzed on both sides...( not on only one side )...we sat down on Sunday around 12:30, had to wait for a 2nd glass of wine ( you know what I mean ) no 5 star makes you wait, for anything, including the check....we waited and waited, then left with a bad taste in our stomachs....

Lovely anniversary dinner - food is always to die for here - never a bad meal.  They accommodated my sons ask of pasta/cheese - my short ribs were amazing - my husband had the pasta with tenderloin tips - he was in heaven.  My aunt had the steak and loved it - my parents inhaled their dishes.  The ambience/atmosphere is very warm and welcoming.  We had a wonderful server Saturday evening who had a great sense of humor just adding to the wonderful visit.  Our anniversary was not 'announced' but our server's attention to detail was incredible as he overheard a conversation and took action to bring us a plate with chocolate goodies.  We shared a bottle of L'ecole with our entrees - - everything was perfect. A++  Can't wait to return. Cave Creek's hidden gem!
Update 11/21/16: Dinner last night at Tonto Bar and Grill and it was a winner again.  Sand Dabs and Walleye were excellent.  Both fish were very fresh with superb raiins.  Great service, too.

Yelp search for vegan food led me and my mom here nice little place on a beautiful golf course. Friendly, knowledgable staff made my inner server glow when they knew which plate went where. Quite a few vegan dishes, delicious local wines. I really dug that they took a lot of local ingredients and added a nice flair to their menu.
Glad I came!

Love this place! Service is fast. I always get their organic grass fed beef hamburger. Their patio is so nice. You get a great view of the golf course and ambiance is nice inside. I would definitely recommend.
Love bringing my out of town friends and family here. Awesome food, great service and beautiful views. Worth the drive and worth every penny. Love it!

This was recommended while I was in the Phoenix area and it was a great choice for lunch.  The views (which are better from the outside patio but it was too hot for that) are nice and the food was above average.  I had the white shrimp tacos and they were well seasoned with great flavor.  The presentation was nice as it was an assemble your own on your own plate.  They could have easily enough called it a de-constructed taco. My collegue had the salad with scallops.  Two large scallops over greens, etc., and a Syria infused goat cheese.  Have to say the mauve color was rather off putting but the flavor was not.  Our third person had a burger which was just that but it did have sweet potato tator tots.  I would go back if I lived there.
beautiful view. little out of the way. food/drinks were decent.

We visited Tonto while traveling to Phoenix for work.   Gorgeous sunset from the outdoor covered patio.   Definitely worth the drive to enjoy the golf course grounds while dining.  The salsa sample with guacamole was our favorite.  Definitely a must order.  

Excellent, prompt service, whether it was delivering drinks or food, or refilling our water glasses.  

Nice variety of cocktails.  We sipped several different mules, martinis, and margaritas.  The bartender accommodated our requests to minimize the sugar,sweeteners in our drinks.  

I ordered the barbecue salmon.  It was okay, and that's why 4 stars.  The salmon was slightly over cooked and not fresh tasting.  The sides were fresh, but almost too many flavors within each accompaniment.   

I would return for the views on the patio over drinks and salsas.

Having had to give up golf due to the fact that something had to give a few years back it is not often that I get to a golf course.
