The Tonto Bar and Grill is sitting right on a beautiful Arizona course. A course I would be in trouble if I played as the fairways are narrow and the greens are small...from what I could see anyway. 

But this is not a golf review so lets get to it.....

Arriving at Tonto for our 6 P.M. reservation a little early so we could soak up some of the area I was mildly surprised by a group of women riding beautiful horses right in front of us and just in front of the sign for Tonto Bar and Grill. It was one of those things that just seemed right. 

Walking the path to the front door you are met with the usual AZ landscape fixtures...cactus...etc...but the lighting and structure are very warm and welcoming in that old west decor way. 

We are met by a couple of hostesses that oddly enough could not find our reservation. This was particularly odd by the fact that I still have the email confirmation response from them for the exact date and time we were there. Oh well...

We were seated outside overlooking the course and the Arizona countryside. The sky was clear and the weather was perfect. It was quite beautiful to say the least as the sun was going down and the painted sky darkened. 

After discussing whether or not to go with a bottle of wine the group decided to head off in their own respective alky direction. 

I ended up having the Dogfish IPA and it was a little mild for an IPA but good nonetheless!!

Our server seemed a bit overwhelmed/distracted/other and was not as attentive as one would expect at a place of this caliber. 

Her shortcomings did not frustrate the group as much as it could have and that is in large part due to the fact you can't help but be relaxed here.

Second beer FINALLY arrives and entrees are ordered!! 

I went with a NY Steak and asked for a substitute potato dish instead of the Yukon Gold fingerlings. 

Asking for a substitution of Sweet Potato Au Gratin seems easy enough but in the end it came a side dish. (See earlier statement about overwhelmed server)

The steak was overcooked but delicious. It was even better after I scraped off the unnecessary blue cheese. 

The Sweet Potato Au Gratins were a masterpiece. thinly slice potato stacked (think lasagna) about 3 inches high!! 

Everyone enjoyed their dishes and coffee and desert was ordered. 

The coffee was fine and the fruit covered creme  brulee was excellent!!


I look forward to going back!!

You have to sit outside. Prettiest views ever! I think it's so great they have a separate vegan menu. I had the vegan tacos and they were delicious. I had to assemble them myself though. For the price I think they should serve them with a better presentation. The vegan gluten free dark chocolate cake with coconut sorbet was fantastic. It's pricey here, but that view makes it all worth it.

The Tonto Bar & Grill is a South West Style Golf Resort Restaurant with a large patio that overlooks a lovely desert golf course. We decided to try Tonto for dinner this time for restaurant week. I latter figured out the restaurant week price of $44.00 for my three course meal was about 50 cents different than the menu.

The weather was nice so I asked to be seated on the patio. I asked for a table in the shade and they pick a table in the blaring sun. At the time there are only two tables seated on the patio with 90% of the other tables available. This sort of rubbed me the wrong way at the time. I try one seat and it's facing the sun blinding me. I get up to try the other seat and the sun is burning my back. I say this table won't work for me. Then they tell me that the sun is only temporary.....Next they offer to seat me inside..how weird is that.....with 90% of the tables still available....Then they offer to set up an umbrella BECAUSE I MUST HAVE THAT TABLE in the blaring sun. I said I'll try it....and it was tolerable so I stayed there.

We get house baked bread and soft creamy butter that's good. Next we get appetizers of Crab Cakes and Compressed Arugula Salad...Both are very good.

All of a sudden they start watering the lawn. I GET SPLASHED with water a few times....

Then dinner arrives....
I get the Onion Crusted Walleye. I thought it was odd that my plate contained two very large piles of tarter sauce on both ends of the plate. I go to try the Walleye. It's almost good....actually it was good until I hit the bloodline and rubbery skin that's covered with onion crust.I was able to eat around it on the three pieces. The shredded carrots were steamed with no added flavor and were topped with fresh spinach. The Walleye in Fish Stick shaped pieces sat on top of what they called a Roesti Cake. It was potatoes that were semi mashed, shaped like a cake seasoned and lightly fried.The potato was good.

My husband got the Root Beer Braised Short Rib. The best part of the plate was the Sweet Potato Casserole with Cheese. It was tasty.......I tried a bite of the rib. It's stringy and sort of dry and very sweet. My husband insisted that I try the green beans. GOD they are a smoke bomb. I actually had to spit the green bean out. I thought the green beans were inedible but maybe other people would like them that way.

Lastly the desserts arrive.
We get a decadent Warm Buttermilk Chocolate Cake with house made pecan ice-cream and a Lemon-Lime Sour Cream Meringue. Both plates are filled with lots of details and extras like assorted cookies and a whimsical cute hand made sugar bumble bee. BOTH DESSERTS are VERY GOOD.


Once seated service was efficient.

Appetizers and the Desserts were VERY GOOD!

Dinner :(

Lovely Patio

It's pricey, but the food is spectacular. There wasn't much on the menu that I didn't think sounded great. I would have given it 5 stars but out service was pretty slow so I just couldn't pull the trigger on that :)

Sit on the lower patio, the views (especially of the sunset) are amazing.

Definitely will be back. We were there on a Tuesday night and the place was packed at 6pm.

I love this place so much! It's time I finally reviewed it. I went last night for my birthday and was so glad I did. They have a really special treat for birthday celebrants. Food, drinks, and  ambiance, all excellent. The only tiny negative - we had a smart aleck waiter who thought he was funny but wasn't. No problem we will just make sure we are not at his table next time.
Great food, superb service, wonderful menu.  My go to place for an elegant date night ... as Yelp says "Yay! I'm a fan."
My husband and I's  favorite spot . The food is always great including the drinks . The staff is awesome and the grounds are stunning. A must try .....you'll be hooked !!

Beautiful setting but that's it. Service very slow, prices very high, and the food wasn't good. The real kicker of this establishment was having to wait in line to go potty. One urinal and one toilet. Hardly crowded but I still waited in line to go. Terrible!

Visiting for a week, my wife and I had a date night out to Tonto.  Knowing Binkley's was down the street and being from the Bay area where good food is king, we didn't not want to get all caught up in a meal.  Instead going to Tonto, the food was good and atmosphere very nice.  I recommend the Corn Chowder soup but the Pork Chops I had were a little overdone.  Otherwise, if you are looking for a $100+ dinner for two....I would recommend if in Cave Creek.

Wow. Great service. Clean space. Amazing views. Tonto meaning smart comes true to life at this restaurant. The food options are great paired with interesting ingredient combinations. A must go to if you're in the Cave Creek, AZ area.

I live in Phoenix and go to Cave Creek for a nice excape from the city. The lower patio is the best place to sit and enjoy the view. Decently priced food and a must try is the bbq salmon, spaghetti squash & spinach I substituted scallops potatoes instead of whatever it comes with.
Try the 3 sisters app- great fry bread and salsas. Gluten free bread for an up charge and great tacos.

The go-to restaurant in downtown Cave Creek for incredible food and ambiance.  Be sure to enjoy your meal on the outdoor patio if you are dining there anytime not during the summer.  Pricey, but worth very penny.  You will not be disappointed.
Delicious burger (corn-fed) and Romaine Brie Salad - we split both, and it was a great meal, accompanied by sweet potato tots.
Beautiful setting. Gorgeous Southwestern dining ambiance. Excellent eclectic Southwestern food. Great martinis. Nice place for event.

Busy at lunch so went outside to the patio to get seated sooner.  Had the nachos and fry bread with awesome sauce and guacamole.  The best part was the salmon.  It had an orange and BBQ tasty glaze.  Yum. Good service, good eats.
Love the atmosphere here, sit outside if you can and you can watch the golfers. Food is good, service is great. Nice, will be back.

Excellent service every time I have been here. The servers are trained and knowledgable and well rehearsed without being stuffy. They also get a lot of help from the AMAZING crew of support staff who bus tables and deliver food. It's almost worth it just to go there to watch them strategically bus a table. They can carry so many plates without worry. I mean, it's hard for me to adequately express how impressed I am by these guys. 
Anyway, the food is always good, with fresh, quality ingredients and prepared with care. 
Tonto-Rita's are no joke. 
It's a little pricey for me but worth the money. Enjoy!

Taken here for dinner earlier this month, April 2013. I'm from out of town.

The service was good. The atmosphere is very nice, especially in the evening. It's a busy, lively place.

We had several appetizers and a salad each. The seared tuna was pretty disappointing. It looked and tasted far more like sushi than what I expected from the description. The shrimp tacos were OK, nothing special. Hey, we were in the desert, can't expect seafood to be great, I guess. The fried bread and different salsa dips were good. All in all, pretty adequate, just not much more than that. 

With drinks, appetizers, salads and soft drinks, our bill for 5 came out to $150.00. Not cheap for what we ate.

I'd go again with a group, but would consider other local choices as well.

There was a great atmosphere here and we sat right on the golf course! The staff was extremely friendly and made sure everything was okay with us. They even have a Vegan menu, which was amazing. I had the Vegan tacos while my friend had the Mediterranean "Pasta" which was very delicious. Definitely recommend this to anyone who is looking for a good priced vegan meal with a view in carefree!

A great place to eat lunch after hiking at Spur Cross Ranch Conservation Area down the road.  There were twelve of us on the patio enjoying the surroundings and new friends.  I started with Sam Adams (a necessity after hiking) and some really delicious bread.  Several of us ordered the Crispy Iceberg  Lettuce, Fried Calamari, Wok Vegetables and Chili Garlic Dressing with the dressing on the side.  In asking the difference between large and small the waitress commented the large has been compared to a trough so we all ordered the small.  More than adequate with lots of hot calamari.  It turned out the chili garlic dressing was mild so we all piled it on.  

Good times on the patio after a great hike along three trails with wildflowers, giant saguaro and even a riparian area that was saved from developers a dozen years ago.

The Tonto Bar & Grill is located  at Rancho Manana which was a former dude ranch. The atmosphere is rustic southwest. The patio has a huge fire pit over looking the golf course 

Service was friendly and prompt. Our Server Nicole was helpful in helping us navigate the menu which is an authentic taste of Arizona with a wide selection and some great choices not found at most restaurants. 
The Tortilla Red Chili Pork soup has Anasazi beans, cotija cheese, cilantro and avocado crème. This soup is hardy and full flavor. The German Pork Schnitzel is tender and served with house made potato salad, lemon caper butter, sauteed green beans, herbed carrots and a grilled lemon. An old world dish with a southwest twist. 
Sauteed Pacific Coast Sand Dabs with a choice of potatoes, malt vinegar butter, roasted Brussels sprouts and gastrique onions. For the starch I choose the sweet potato hash with corn and chiles. An excellent combination of flavors. I consider Sand Dabs a real treat as they are not readily available

One of the best lunches ever!!  Started with a wonderful margarita - house made, none of that awful sweet and sour mix.  I had the grilled long stem artichokes with a local cheese, chorizo fondue.  Absolutely delicious.  Great bread as well. My sweetie has the blt with fried green tomatoes.  Ate it all - which is unusual.  Came with great fries.  Our waiter, Martin, was great.  He couldn't get higher marks for service and graciousness.  Yumm!!!

Okay...this was very surprising since it was just voted Best Southwestern food in PHX mag's Best of the Valley issue...and thus, it made us want to have a visit.

I LOVE southwestern food...and I was very let down by this place.  I feel like I should give it 3 stars...but as an "A-OK" rating, I just can't.  If 3 stars were for "OK food" then I'd give it 3 stars.  But truly, I have...I have had better.

PHX Mag said to try the crab cakes, which we did, and they were delicious.  Very happy with them and therefore expected the entrees to be just as great...but they weren't.  : (  I had the salmon, which the waitress recommended and it was such a bummer.  It had way too many conflicting tastes going on that didn't seem to blend at all.  I lost my appetite after a few bites.  My boyfriend had the shrimp tacos which were just...average.  We were really disappointed.  

Again, the crab cake appetizer was great and the two margaritas were as well - the Tontorita and the Prickly Pear - both very, very yummy.  

But overall, if PHX Mag continues to recommend more lame-oid meals, I'm gonna have to start using it as wrapping paper instead of a go-to guide for great meals in this town.

This review is specifically for the food that was served at my sisters wedding at Tonto bar and grill. The location of where they set up the reception is beautiful. There is a large tree next to it and it's overlooking the golf course. I'm not sure how involved the restaurant was in regards to the decor of the actual wedding so I will just talk about the food. They served three appetizers: empanadas, shrimp ceviche, and a caprese with burrata. The empanadas were honestly the best thing I ate the entire night. They were crispy on the outside and I don't even know exactly what they were filled with but they were delicious. I must of had about 10 of  these things throughout the night. Shrimp ceviche was good as well and the tomatoes with burrata were good but the tomatoes were so big that it was almost hard to eat them. The entree is where it went downhill for me. They served a southwestern style salad with a chipotle ranch dressing type of dressing. I was not a big fan of the side dishes that they had and for the main entree they served a pork tenderloin and a bbq chicken. I thought that the pork was flavorful but I heard from some people that there pork was pretty dry. Chicken was just okay but there was only bbq sauce on top of it and I wanted some more flavor. The appetizers got the night started off right but the entrees and sides made the experience mediocre for the food. There was also a discrepancy about the alcohol package that my sister and brother in law purchased with their meal package. They had told them that beer and wine was included, but at the end of the night the employees were stating that they needed to fork over $650 for the beer and wine. Hopefully they can get this fixed because that would be pretty messed up if they said it was included to find out that it wasn't.

If you ask me, the name "bar and grill" is deceiving. I hear that and think Chilis, Zipps, etc. Well, let me tell you, this place doesn't come close to being placed in the same category as your standard bar/grill. My parents are Cave Creek residents, and boy are we glad that Yelp helped us stumble across this place. 

The ambiance is great. Nestled in a resort on the golf course- gorgeous location with soft lighting. We sat on the patio which was enclosed and kept very warm on a cold day in the dead of (an Arizona) winter. 

The service was top notch. Our water glasses were never left less than half full. Those bussers were on it. The server made great recommendations and gave good insight on menu options. 

We went with the guac/salsa trio as an appetizer. It included a generous serving of fry bread and deliciously double fried tortilla chips-- so so good. The fry bread was a unique touch you don't typically see served with salsa/guac, but more restaurant should pick up on the idea!! 

For entrees, our group ordered a variety of stuff and we stole bites off of each other's plates, so we luckily were able to try a lot. The pork schnitzel was the table favorite- hands down. The lemon sauce served with the dish was heavenly. The bbq orange salmon was a close second, but very fishy. To be expected (duh, it's salmon), but I expected the sauce to be more overwhelming in taste. Not a bad thing, and definitely a delicious cut of salmon. Both pasta dishes were good, but I would not order those over the other options. Even the bread and butter to start was deelish. The blt got a good grade with sweet potato tots, as did the veggie dish-- just not standouts.

We'll be back!! I recommend it highly. Now, looking forward to trying their sister restaurant-- Cartwrights. And one last important thing to note- chocolate mints at the exit from the (free) gum ball machine. Gotta love that!!

Located at the Rancho Mañana Golf Resort in Cave Creek. Beautiful setting. Get there in time to view the grounds by setting outside before the sun sets.
Good selection on the menu including steaks, chicken and fish.

Epic food either fancy or simple.  Consistent year around which is tough in a seasonal resort town. 

We have never had a bad meal.  Great staff.

What a great dining experience! The vegetable nosh was fantastic! The short ribs were delicious! We wish we could have been seated outside. The atmosphere was great!
Dessert, chocolate cake, was super as well! Highly recommend this spot.

Went for Restaurant Week ($30). 

I had the arugula & manchego, candied Arizona pecan, sun-dried cherry, green apple salad with the pistachio vinaigrette. It was waaaaaay overdressed. Which was a bummer because the salad and the dressing were both good. I guess there is such thing as: "too much of a good thing." 

My entree selection was the pork schnitzel served with warm German potato salad. Despite still being pink inside, it was tough for as thin as it had been -- not sure what happened.  I brought half of the pork home and it was barely better the next day. 

Of course, I had to save room for the white nougat semifreddo which was a great ending on warm summer evening.

The setting was pretty and the portions were generous. The food was good but not "destination worthy," which is my measure for that fourth or fifth star, when places are outside my "bubble." Mind you: I WILL (and often DO) travel for food. This is a place I would definitely stop at if I were already there but probably not make the trek to Cave Creek just for it.

I admit my rating may reflect that TBAG was our third attempt to dine out last Saturday night.  But dang, it was good!!!!

By the time we arrived at Tonto, it was close to 8.30.  We had spent almost one hour at the first restaurant hoping that we might eventually get food; only 5-10 minutes at the second establishment before we said: we're going back to Cave Creek----then there was the drive back from Carefree, so we were starving.  And we still needed to make sure the restaurant was vegetarian friendly.

Tonto IS vegetarian friendly! In fact, they have a menu that has a page of vegan offerings and a page of gluten-free. Wow!

Tho it was late, we never felt like a burden.  All the service was outstanding.  And the food was FABULOUS!  We way over-ordered because we were so hungry, but they also have eco-friendly take-away boxes!

We have decided Tonto is our new favorite Cave Creek restaurant.  (Altho we still love Heart & Soul)

5 stars for perfect ambience, service, and affordable menu choices in addition to $$$$ menu choices. There is something for every palate and budget on this menu. We ordered a bottle of inexpensive $30 Chardonnay, a sushi roll, and 2 salads with 6 oz chicken. The salads were huge and delicious... We could have easily split 1 and made it a meal! The sushi roll was good but not off the charts, but worth a try.  The salads were approx $12 each... Amazing price for such stellar resort style surroundings!  We will be back! Next time will try the prickly pear margos!

This was an amazing place to celebrate my birthday. We sat on the lower patio and enjoyed drinks, spectacular food, a sunset and a hole in one! (I can't promise you will see a hole in one) The staff was friendly, food outstanding, and the atmosphere was stellar.

My family of 6 people ate dinner here last Saturday night. We sat outside on the patio and received excellent service.  The food and drinks are spot on!  It is a busy place so make reservations.  It is in a golf community and used to be an old ranch so there are mature trees and beautiful landscaping.

We loved this place and hope to return someday. Brenda was our server and she was knowledgeable, attentive and amusing as well as a hard-core mom of teenagers.

We ordered bloody mary's, which we often do, and Brenda was the first server EVER to offer Absolut Peppar vodka which we always request anyways.

The food and wine was fabulous, I was happy with the wine selection which included a few local wines. The 4 of us shared a shrimp appetizer and a tortilla/Indian bread with salsas appetizer. Our salads were superb. I ordered a butter lettuce salad with lemon dressing. The ingredients in every bite were so fresh. For an early dinner my Mr. and I split a beef medallion which came with red bell pepper mashed potatoes. Delish.

Enjoy!

I've been wanting to eat here for years and finally did! I was expecting so much more tho. My BLT was fantastic, but another person in my party ordered the BLT and her bread was over toasted. The service on the other hand... the waitress, Nicole (I think) was rather rude. She had a bit of an attitude when telling her what couples where on what tab, then rolled her eyes when another person asked for a mixed drink. She also was rude when clearing off the tables but realized it and finally said "excuse me" but again with a bit of a attitude. The bar tender was also pretty rude. I'm not sure if it was his first night working in a higher end restaurant but when I went to the bar before happy hour was over he lied and told me happy hour was over and that I would have to order my drink from my server. I later found out you couldn't order a drink from the bar if you had a table but the happy hour only took place in the bar. We would have loved to sat in the bar area but they didn't have a table large enough for all of us. Other than those 2 the place was good. The other servers were on point when filling up our waters and making sure we had plenty of bread and butter. Maybe it was just a bad night for Nicole the server and the bar tenders first night there. But when working in hospitality rolling your eyes and getting an attitude is not the best.

This is one of those places that gives you massive portions to allot for their somewhat higher pricing. However, overall I felt it was worth it.

We dined on the patio outside, along the golf course, in the evening when it was cooler out. I had a salad, which I mistakenly did NOT order the half size! I was brought a regular full size which could definitely feed a small family. Haha. Very tasty and fresh, I really enjoyed it.

Our server was a bit aloof. She just didn't seem to be there and maybe was a little stressed out or overwhelmed. Very sweet girl though.
I've never had a bad  meal at Tonto Bar and Grill.  The food is delicious (try the Walleye) and the ambience doesn't get much better any where else....Great seenic vistas on the large outside patio.

What a disappointment. Made a reservation with open table: all time slots available. Arrive at restaurant and are taken to first table in the bar with a private wedding party. Incredibly loud and warm. Not close to being worth a $200 dinner. Expressed our displeasure but too bad it would be at least 1/2 hour for another table. One dinner out of four was an issue and the extremely generous manager offered us a desert on the house for one of the worst dining experiences ever. Trust me the attitude of the restaurant is not worth it. There are many great restaurants in town.

This is the place I go when I want to bring a friend to dinner or a guest from out of town. The atmosphere is so nice, comfortable, not loud, not crammed in. Small bar area. The Chef is phenomenal!!! Great for vegetarians also.

They wouldn't accept photo ID, we drove more than 30min there after work and they wouldn't let us order a drink with photo ID. Bartender was very rude, totally ruined our mood for dinning. Then later they canceled my reservation on OpenTable even we ordered already. I guess they were afraid we are going to leave a negative review in OpenTable and people can see it. Overall it was a bad experience.

We have been here a few times and always enjoyed the food.   The back patio is very nice and with 2 levels it offers a lot of seating.     We recently came for dinner on a Friday night.   

The Compressed Arugula salad was excellent.  I asked for light dressing and it was perfect.    The Black Cod dish was also very good (except for the potatoes which had a very odd flavor and texture).  My husband really enjoyed his   Prime Rib Steak and Cheese.   The Lemon-Lime Sour Cream Meringue Pie was a disappointment.  The crust was far too thick.    

The food came out quickly - far too quickly in fact.     I was not even finished eating my salad (and I am not a slow eater) and the entrees were served.

Tonto does a good job of infusing southwestern flair into the menu with prickly pear margaritas and Bison steaks.  I just get the feeling that sometimes one can go too far.  

Salmon with bbq sauce?  My short ribs were nicely cooked but they were smothered in a sauce which sort of distracts from the flavor.  Other items were equally hit and miss.  

The crab cakes are surprisingly good with a nice spicy slaw.

I am shocked that no one has reviewed Tonto Bar & Grill since Francesca's 4 star review back in March...

I've been to Tonto Bar & Grill a handful of times and I've never been disappointed.  Most recently, I went for lunch on a beautiful Sunday afternoon.  My BF and I sat outside and enjoyed the fresh air and beautiful view of the Rancho Manana Golf Course as we dined.  

I will agree with Francesca that this is a rustic but extremely classy restaurant.  It's warm and cozy inside and has the feel of a lodge but serves higher end cuisine... "all natural" meats and a variety of fresh salad, soups, veggies, breads, and desserts prepared daily.  I recently learned that Tonto uses many native AZ products and supports the Native SEARCH seed program (whatever that is but it sounds really great).

Back to my Sunday afternoon lunch...
After taking a while to peruse the menu and enjoying a fine basket of fresh bread and butter, we decided to share a large Cowboy Cobb Salad with Lemon Herb Vinaigrette and Crumbled Bleu Cheese.  The salad came with chicken, bacon, egg, tomato, cucumber, and an avocado fan on top.  It was the perfect size for 2 to share and they split it in the kitchen for us which made it easy.  Since we were hungry we each ordered a side item as well.  I had the acorn squash - it was seasoned just right and melted in my mouth... I would order it again and again - it tasted like candy!  I think Jared was envious of the squash since he kept coming back for more.  He ordered the barley and mushroom risotto as a side and he enjoyed it but it didn't compare to the acorn squash.

Service was pretty good although our side items were not brought out until at least 10 minutes after our salad.  The view of the golf course made up for that easily, as did the fact that we were in no rush. 

In past visits, I've tasted the salmon, scallops, and grouper as well as several of the veggies.  I love that the menu has so many options to choose from... there is something for everyone from the meat and potato lover to the strict vegetarian.  It's really fun to go with a group so you can taste a little of everything.

Tonto Bar & Grill is a great spot that is worth venturing out to if you're looking for something different!
Quintessential Arizona Dining....beautiful views and excellent food.  There is a reason this is the most popular place in town!

Although we have golfed here several times, this was the first time eating at the restaurant and we really enjoyed it. The ambiance is very nice. Very rustic cowboy with higher end dining done in a casual setting. If your a golfer, a local or vacationer, all is welcomed and it feels comfortable. This would be a great location to take out of town guests to. We had the corn chowder and tamale crusted crab cakes to start and then we shared the entire which was the Pork Schnitzel. We enjoyed all the dishes. Great food, setting and service. The patio in colder months is heated and the views are spectacular.
This is a go-to place for me and my girlfriends. The food is always good, and the ambiance is relaxed yet very pretty. I have yet to have a dish that I don't like.
I had be shrimp tacos and they were fantastic!! Highly recommend!! The atmosphere is pretty nice and fancy. Great service and awesome appetizers!
Very comfortable vibe here.  Warm and cozy decor complete with good food and service.  Moderate pricing.  The outdoor patio is especially enjoyable on a pleasant aggression or evening.
Great views, great food. Love it. Enjoy bringing out if town guests here or going here for special occasions.

From soup to nuts this was a great place. The view is spectacular from the outside garden. The only negative would be the food is served rather quickly between courses. The server advised me that in the future just tell them to slow down a bit and it will be done. Nothing bad to say about this place
Best Eggs Benedict , great service and wonderful golf course views on Tonto Patio. Nice setting to take that special someone.

This place was so awesomely good. It had a cozy atmosphere, a great waitstaff, and the food was to die for. The flavors were robust and interesting. We had the Three Sisters Salsa, the special soup (a lovely, mildly spicy Pozole soup), and then I had a Tumbleweed salad with Mesquite-grilled tenderloin. Other at my table had the tempura ahi tuna roll (and it was a HUGE hit), the white shrimp tacos, and the penne pasta. Each and every one of us were impressed. 

For a bunch of out-of-towners looking for some tasty Arizona eats, this was the place to be.
Not that good anymore. The happy hour is ok. If your looking for a great place in that area, go to the lariat in carefree !!!!!

This restaurant is tucked on a beautiful golf course. Nestled in with views of the greens the food was plentiful and the service attentive. 
The waitress didn't use a pad and remembered everything. Plenty of vegan and vegetarian options and a staff wanting to please. The vegan chocolate cake was amazing. Great place to kick back and relax.

I have eaten lunch here on several occasions and it is awesome!  The bread they bring to the table (made there) is wonderful and warm and the food is so good. I really like the grass-fed burger and it is one of the best burgers I have ever had.  Being on a golf course, the views are really nice too.

My friend was in town house hunting. We were exhausted and hungry. I remember the hummus trio app on the menu. My friend is a vegetarian. We ordered the trio which was very good. I enjoyed all the fresh cut veggies on the plate. We both ordered salads. I had the compressed arugula salad. WOW! Delicious! I am craving this salad. I like that you can order two different sizes with the salads. 
Our server Nicole (I think that was her name) was fabulous. The servers assistants are on spot filling our glasses of Arnold Palmer's. Great experience for my friend who will soon be a Creeker!

My absolute favorite in Cave Creek or anywhere, for that matter. Friendly staff, unequaled ambiance and outstanding menu. The corn chowder is a meal
In itself, and the best burger of local corn or grass fed beef in the West more than satisfies. If you want a mid afternoon bite with your cocktail, the crispy deviled eggs reign, or dip into Three Sisters Salsa...delicious! Worth a drive into the country...you have time to experience this special place!

I usually don't go this low with the stars but this restaurant deserves it. I had come across the country to visit my family and the first night here we went to this restaurant. I called to make sure my therapy dog was allowed, they said yes. I have heart failure so my dog can detect if my defibrillator will go off when I am not home. I also have PTSD from being so ill for 33 years. I have a lot of medical problems but I don't look it, and I was still almost half the age of most diners. A very elderly man started being very rude to me because of my therapy dog who weighs less than 8 pounds. He was two tables away and my dog didn't bark or bother him in anyway. This man asked me what was wrong with me " it was really none of his business" I started with my 3 kidney transplants and he laughed and said he had a shoulder transplant. What ignorance! He was getting loud as was I. Not the server or manager or anybody from the restaurant came over as a matter of fact they were snippy with me. I have never encountered anything in my entire 53 years of life like this. They allowed me to bring in my pet because it is the law yet did nothing when I was being humiliated and berated by this man. My family member had to stick up for me when he wouldn't shut up! As for the expensive food? The crabcakes were bland. The scallops tasted like nothing as a matter of fact the best part of my meal was the little bit of food they put under the scallops. The strip steak and filet were fine but the Mac n Cheese and Asparagus were not. You can decide if you would like to pay for that kind of service or food. If you are handicapped I would steer clear of this place!!

I absolutely am in love with the steak with blue cheese butter, but the last time I went, well it frankly just sucked.  It was Father's Day, so I'm hoping it was because they were so busy... but I hope the next time I go I won't be disappointed.  Please DONT start sucking!!!  I've been bragging about you for everrrr!!!!!

Excellent food and a nice view of the golf course.  A good selection of food and/or salads.  The food is always tasty and wait staff are pleasant.  The only things is it appears a bit dark in the restaurant.  Sometimes it is hard to see the menu with the lack of lighting.

I'm pretty sure Tonto Bar & Grill is my favorite place to eat in AZ.  We've been coming here for special occasion dinners for close to 10 years and I've never been disappointed.  If the weather's nice, definitely get a seat on the patio - amazing views with occasional javelina sightings!  I always order the schnitzel and it's AMAZING - though the burgers, pastas and salads are incredible as well.
This is such a cool. Restaurant.. I go here quite often, with family and friends.. beautiful  view of mountains,  and golf course, the food is good,  and they have great Margarita's....
The food and service were just average tonight. I was surprised how long it took the waiters to light the outdoor heaters knowing the sun went down a 1/2 hour prior to the heaters turned on.

We had a fantastic meal at Tonto last night. The Mexican martini was fantastic made with real lime juice.  The gazpacho was amazing with a bit of a Mexican twist (jicama and a small amount of spice).  The ancho rubbed filet was just right and accompanied by potatoes with manchego cheese was a real winner.  We finished our evening with a slice of the lemon lime meringue pie.  Really one of the best meals we've had in the Phoenix area.

Our go to place for when we want a nice dinner and feel like being pampered a bit. Great menu, nice drinks and always top notch service.  Do your self a favor, have lunch on their patio on a beautiful day over looking the patio or on a gorgeous evening on the patio.  You will love it. The prices are just a tad high for us to go often but 100% worth every penny.  Make reservations for the weekends because there is usually a wait. Love this place.

The calamari appetizer was great! But the pasta we ordered was flavorless. It took a while for our server to come back and re fill our drinks and they were not busy. But hey everyone has their off days.

I have eaten here twice now, once with friends who took me, and the other time with my husband.  Both times it was great!  The service was really good, and the food is great.  The atmosphere is casual to fine dining, an in between.  The history of the building and art inside is really cool!  You can't go wrong!

I just love this place!  The people are always so friendly, and the atmosphere is fantastic!  It's romantic, family friendly, and relaxed all at the same time.  The food is great!  We especially like to dine out on the patio.
Great view! There was evening a wedding going on there. Wonderful food and a great place to bring out of town guests during good weather.

Nice looking place , stopped in for an early dinner , staff was very friendly , Sara our waiter very nice , started with the devilled eggs which we didn't care for much , wife had the orange crusted salmon which was awesome , I had the prime rib sandwich it was also very good , for $65 we thought it was well worth it , looking at other guests dishes we would like to come back and try something new

I've been coming here for years and it never disappoints.  Great location, service, food and drinks.  The tontorita is the best margarita and their guac and salsa with homemade fried bread and tortilla chips is amazing.  This is the real deal. Never disappointed.
One of my wife and I's favorite restaurant in town. The appetizers are great and if you can get a seat on the patio during sunset it is breathtaking. Highly recommend it.
John and his team run a great place.  The ambiance is great, menu impeccable, and love the wylie javelina that roam the property.  I take guest here all the time.

This is everything you want dining in Arizona to be. The views from the patio area were beautiful. The menu has solid choices at each price point. I would highly recommend the chips and salsa appetizer that comes with guacamole and fried bread. The interior has a very authentic feel.

The menu looked fabulous but every meal at our table was average in flavor and appearance. The meals were quite pricey for lunch; I had the onion crusted walleye which was $26. The fish was moist and the portion size was good but the meal was quite bland. I also tried one of the cocktails, the Wild Silvestre Cooler ($13). It was syrupy sweet - like not drinkable. I asked for them to put it in a larger glass with more soda water and lime - this made it drinkable but not good. Overall, the customer service was good, the setting (outside patio overlooking the golf course) was very nice but the food was disappointing. I'm not sure I will be back.

Ambiance is great, and food is, as always, delicious.  Price point for 2 for Anniversary Luncheon was around $100 after tip, no drinks.  Parking is tight if you get here during "peak" hours.  High percentage of seniors in the "audience" just as an FYI--nothing wrong with that, just not a "younger crowd," as to be expected, I guess, in Cave Creek.  Everything is pretty much organic and expertly prepared.  Lots of menu variety.  Eclectic interior that in one section lets you cozy up by the fire.  We have always enjoyed eating here and will definitely be back!

How totally incredible to have such exquisite fine dining after a long day of museums, hikes, and visits.  You will need to make reservations at least 2 days in advance.  The chef prepared our meal in such a way that every layer of taste was delivered with perfection.  I had the smoked salmon with white cream sauce, lemon and capers. We were seated on the patio facing the golf course with heaters going and the stars were out.  The staff was superb; everything about this restaurant makes it our HIGHEST recommendation for fine dining in Scottsdale.

The perfect afternoon at Tonto is 2 prickly pear margaritas, the Three Sisters Salsa with a side of guac, and dessert. Their desserts are often-changing (sometimes, just made for that day) and awesome! We are usually the youngest people in the place. But, we are usually there on Friday afternoons or weeknights.

When there for dinner, I get a burger and sweet potato tots. The margaritas are good...not weak like some of the local places. I am pretty happy after two. 

If you go on your birthday, tell them. You get this little box with a couple of handmade chocolates. TO DIE FOR! Also, follow them on facebook. They post pics of new dishes and dessserts a few times a week. Sometimes we change our plans based on these pics!

We returned to Tonto Bar & Grill for our 2nd visit.  We are staying at the Rancho Manana Resort, so the restaurant is very convenient.  We ordered the grass fed beef burgers with fries.  They were cooked perfectly and the taste was awesome.  We try to stay with our organic and non GMO diets as much as possible and this was the perfect solution for us.  Can't wait to come back to Cave Creek and eat here again.

Used to be one of our favorite restaurants. Had lunch there yesterday. Each of us got a salad which was mediocre at best. The price of a salad was $16 without any protein. I got the Cobb. I had to hunt to find the peppered bacon. Mostly romaine and some halves of cherry tomatoes. The lemon vinegrett was not great either. My friends felt the same about their salads - expensive and not very good. The drinks were expensive and small. My friend ordered a Bloody Mary and practically had to beg to get a drink k of celery and a pickle in it.   Sorry Tonto's but it is not likely I will be back due to disappointing food and a server that didn't have the smarts to make it invisible to the customer in order to give them what they wanted.

Amazing ambiance, views and food, everything Arizona has to offer
AND MORE, the staff is always friendly food is always excellent
and atmosphere is peaceful and sooooo southwest....
the furnishings unique and menu always changes, love it!

This place  used to be our go to place in Cave Creek. But yesterday 3/16/18 was the worst food that we have ever have in many years. My wife order the Ruben Sandwich, the meat was very dry and hard. This being 1 day before St Patrick's day you would think that they would have a good supply of corn beef on hand. I ordered the cream corn soup as a starter, there was absolutely no corn! It was almost like warmed up milk. My main course was the Prime rib and cheese steak sandwich, with grilled onions. I kid you not, there was less than 1 oz of beef on the sandwich. There was about 3 oz onions, which over powered the taste. The meat was not what I call Prime rib either. I should have sent it back, but we had been waiting a long time and we had other tings to do. The Kicker is when the waitress came to ask about our food, she made a comment that the best Prime Rib sandwich that she likes is just down the road! This used to be the place to bring our out of town guests for a great meal; BUT NOT ANY MORE!

We used to love this grill.  The previous chef left and they hired some young chef who can't hold a candle to the previous chef.  Too bad, we really liked going up to Cave Creek for dinner.  Better pass now.

Food, service, and ambieance was excellent! Definitely recommend take a nice drive to cave creek to enjoy the scenery and beautiful weather this time of year. I had the filet, it was delicious! Wait staff was attentive, one man adjusted umbrellas continuously as the sun was setting to be sure no one had sun in their eyes!
The service was great as was the entire staff we encountered. The food was a disappointment.  Happy to pay relatively high cost for good food but this place didn't deliver.

This is my favorite place in the Carefree area.  I have never been disappointed with the food.  I love to sit outside and look at the golf course.  They light heaters at night, when the temperatures drop on the course.  There is a great small patio off of the bar that is very nice, too.  The staff is extremely attentive.  It is a beautiful place.  Many of the "locals" dine there, so that is a great recommendation.  It can be semi-casual.  It is a good place to take a date or out-of-town visitors.  All in all, it is a classy place with fabulous food..... grass-fed beef, too!!  The vegetable nosh is extraordinary.

Hamburger (corn fed variety which means it's from Iowa) was good, chips and salsa were ok but what I loved about this place was sitting there for 2-1/2 hours and looking out at the beautiful yard with the hill in the distance.  Boy, when I find a guy to go out with we're going there....muy romantico!
Cute, clean, nice place and would I go back?  Yup...sure would.
The lunch to me was just okay, but I was with a whole bunch of girlfriend and with the good service and excellent view...well, it was just a perfect place for a long chat.

The setting, decor and energy are a 5 star. Sitting outside, under heaters if the night is cool, with candlelight and golf course and mountain views is spectacular. The menu includes burgers and sandwiches, seafood, vegetarian and beef dishes. The problem for us was that the food was lousy. Short ribs were dry, pasta bland with a crunchy something in it that was odd. A side Caesar salad ($7) was boring and tasteless. What a disappointment. The setting is so charming that we might go back but we'd try burgers and see if it's better.

Perfect! Perfect! Perfect! We ate in the bar. Lovely setting. Yummy food and cocktails. Great service. My BLT with fried green tomato and avocado was delicious. My friend enjoyed their tacos. I look forward to a return visit.

I had the shrimp tacos, which were fabulous. My mom had the chicken tacos, which were less flavorful than mine. (She also didn't like that she had to put her own lunch together. I thought it was fun and I like to control the condiments, so I was perfectly happy to assemble my tacos). 

Very knowledgeable and friendly staff, nice beer list. I haven't eaten in Carefree, but my guess is that it's worth the short drive to head over here for lunch in the middle of a Carefree shopping day!

We've been to their other restaurant several times so we thought we'd love this place.  The service was ok, although we did need to hunt down a server on a few occasions to fill our drinks.  The main dish of pork schnitzel was too greasy, I barely touched my plate.  The salsa appetizer was good, especially the indian fry bread. We'll probably give it another try since we are locals, but we liked Cartwright's so much better.

Tonto Bar & Grill continues to be one of my favorite restaurants in the North Valley.  The food is consistently impressive.  I have had multiple items including the root beer braised short ribs and various seafood items.  None have disappointed.  They have a few beers to choose from and full bar.  The deserts menu changes seasonally and not being a big dessert guy, have to admit theirs are delicious.  I highly recommend sitting on the patio near sunset.  The patio is right on the golf course, but not close enough to get an errant ball.  I've been there about 5 times and every time I say we should go more often.

Went to Tonto Bar and Grill the day before Thanksgiving to pick up our Thanksgiving to go order.  I'll talk about that later.  We decided to stay and order a couple of apps an drinks at the bar.  The beers were great.  Their chicken corn chowder was the best I've ever had.  The three sisters salsa and chips was good but not the best.  The guacamole was pretty delicious, I will say.  I look forward to going back.  We picked up their Thanksgiving to go for the next day and that was quite delicious.  Being from out of town, we didn't want to spend all of our time cooking for two people but we also didn't want to dress up and go out so we got dinner from them.  It was a great decision.  The food was delicious and was enough to have leftovers for the day after Thanksgiving.  Love this place and will definitely be back.

Let me start by saying I was a bit apprehensive about dining at Tonto Grill. My husband and I ate here perhaps 8 years ago and cannot recall anything memorable. In addition, some of the reviews here gave me pause, however, the three other diners and I were exceptionally happy with our dining experience here. 
The service - friendly, professional and attentive. The staff were every thing you want in a fine dining experience. Nice job Nicole and Devon. 
We started off with calamari and crab cakes. We really enjoyed our appetizers, particularly the crab cakes layered on roasted chili slaw. The slaw was a wonderful compliment to the crab cakes which had a beautifully crusted outer layer. We really enjoyed the combination of flavors and textures.
For our main courses, two of us had the walleye pike, one had the filet, and another had the seared scallops.  As I was taking my first bite of my walleye, I heard a unison of mmmmm around the table as the other 3 diners took their first bites. The flavors of each protein and its accompanying vegetable side were absolutely delectable. I had the opportunity to sample all the entrees - each was cooked to perfection and melted in my mouth. We spoke with the Chef Miguel to extend our thanks and congratulations on such a remarkable and enjoyable meal. 
To top off the entrees we each ordered a dessert - lemon meringue pie, buttermilk chocolate cake, chocolate coconut cake and creme brûlée. I would consider the desserts all A+ as everyone finished theirs (except me who could not get another bite in). 
We thoroughly enjoyed our meal here except for one small misstep - the coffee - which was way too strong. It was an exceptional meal and we will certainly recommend Tonto Grill and Chef Miguel.
Been here many times and the food is always consistently fresh and good just wish they'd broaden their draft selection.

I guess our server needed us out in a hurry. I barely touched my salad before the entrees came. The drink orders weren't right, and there was a child just running and screaming in the bench seats. It all ruined a relaxing night I was looking forward to. The food was very good, though.

We are moving to this neck of the woods soon and even though we'd dined here a few years ago, we wanted to try it out again, now that it's in "our neighborhood". SUPERB!  We had two friends with us who loved it and were surprised, like us, at the "upscale-ness" of the menu.  The food was beautifully presented and really delicious!  We had the pork schitzel, barbecued salmon (and our guests had something else I can't recall what).  We all loved the food.  The ambiance is cozy, "Old West"...charming & intimate.  Our server, Nicole, was a doll.....funny, informative, & very accommodating to our questions & requests.  There was a wedding on the patio and it looked like the guests were having a ball  (it was a lovely setting).
Toto Bar & Grill is Definitely now on our list of "regular" dining experiences.....as good or better than many of the chi-chi, high-end restaurants in Scottsdale.

We found the best food - quality and value - at golf resorts.  Go figure.  Staff seemed to outnumber guests, but they weren't in the way.  Portions were very generous considering the reasonable prices.  Tuna roll appetizer was a meal in itself.  The house burger (i got the grass fed version), cooked just as I wanted it (medium rare), and with the fixings I was completely stuffed.  Their special wine was a Stag's Leap - need i say more?  We sat on the terrace overlooking a fairway and green, and surrounded by gorgeous mountains, saguaro cacti and vast blue sky.  I was happy to pay the bill.

The food here has gotten better over the years. Have been coming here about 5 years now when we visit my sister. Love the salads and the fish dinners.  We will continue to come every time we are in town.

We eat here fairly often, and while I am not happy with some of the portion sizes/prices, it is still always a top-notch experience. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable and the gluten-free offerings are among the best anywhere. One of the best restaurants in the Valley.

Had reservations for four last night.  Place was slammed with people, very crowded.  We were told we had to wait later than our reservation time, then when seated, told we had to wait for drinks because the bar was backed up.  For an upscale restaurant, poor planning, intentional overbooking - felt rushed and not relaxing like a diner. Waiters pushing through waiting crowd in the foyer. 

Arugula salad delicious but crab cakes overpowered by flavor of the corn and the calamari boring, not hot.  The main dishes bland, just average. Overall disapponting.

My girlfriend and I ventured out to Arizona for a weekend. We came across Tonto and decided to give it a go for lunch (looked beautiful from the outside, set in a country-club setting with amazing vistas). 

We began our meal with the 3 sisters salsas and chips. The chips were homemade and absolutely incredible. The accompanying salsas were also delicious. 

I ordered a burger and it was incredible. Without question, one of the top 10 I have ever eaten in my lifetime. I'd detail it all, but pretty much every aspect was good. 

One of the better meals I have ever had.

This is the place to bring visitors and meet friends.  Food is always good.  Servers are prompt and informative about specials, etc.  Nothing is more wonderful than sitting outside on a warm winter day, watching the golfers and javelinas and having lunch with friends.  I love the salad choices...with or without protein.  Have been going here for years....with gratitude!

Excellent Az wine and appetizer menu.  Pricey, but worth it.  Kind of out in the middle of bfe, do make sure you can drive afterwards.   Oh and be on the lookout for wild boars running around especially at night.
Great and civilized dining.  Good menu.  Atmosphere is worth the visit.  Have had dinners and lunch there.  You will not be disappointed.

This place never disappoints. A true taste of Arizona in a picturesque dining room.

Their burgers and Steaks are especially impressive, but really everything I've ever tried has exceeded my expectations. 

They also have an in-house pastry chef - so desert is a MUST!

Love eating outside overlooking the golf course or in the bar. They have a fabulous burger and great martinis. Try the happy hour. 
They serve Walleye and sand dabs, which you don't see very often in AZ.
Very pretty setting.

Cave Creek probably has the best restaurants per capita in Arizona!  In business since 1994, Tonto Bar and Grill may be the dean of Cave Creek fine dining.

We had a Saturday reservation at 5:30pm and by 6:00pm there wasn't an empty seat in the place.  As aptly described in Cameron K's review, the tontorita is not to be missed!  Mine was lightly splashed with orange juice and I look forward to another one soon.

I don't normlly pay much attention to the obligatory basket of bread, but Tonto's was freshly baked, flavorful and served with whipped butter.

The salads are completely fresh and the presentation is excellent.  I had the compressed arugula and Spanish manchego cheese salad with candied Arizona pecans, sun-dried tomatoes, tart cubed green apples and pistachio vinaigrette.  Like the tontorita, I look forward to having this, again, soon!

My entree was a bowl of penne pasta with sauteed beef tips, black beans, corn, tomatoes, red onions, and feta cheese in a very mild red chili sauce.  I hate to use the old cliche, but it was a taste explosion in my mouth!  It was delicious beyond description.

Finally, my two friends and I divided dessert three ways and we had the warm buttermilk chocolate cake with candied pecan ice cream and warm chocolate sauce.  On a scale of 1 to 10, it was off the charts at about a 30!!!

This is a favorite place to take out of town guests.  The atmosphere is relaxed, the service is excellent and the food is marvelous.  It is a place that guests will long remember and talk about after their visits to Arizona.

Buh-Bye Tonto.  I have been going to Tonto for 13 years.  This has been my go to celebration restaurant, birthdays, anniversaries, retirements, Saturday afternoons, etc. After today's experience, I'm taking a sabbatical.  The veggie nosh portion has been shrinking for at least six months.  Today I ordered the Manchego scalloped potatoes, the sweet potato leek onion gratin, the spinach, asparagus and carrots.  The carrots were unremarkable in flavor.  Spinach was good but literally was a mere three bites, TINY portion.  Asparagus was too charred, all 6 spears.  The Manchego potatoes were drowning in butter and cream, which is delicious but disallowed any significant flavor or texture for Tonto to call their own. The sweet potato gratin had a little more flavor but was, like the spinach, a child size portion.  

I usually order the lemon caper sauce but today I tried the basil pesto cream.  Ga-ROSS!  Seriously, tasted like detergent was the primary ingredient, basil was undetectable.  

The service has also been declining.  Gone are the servers like Judah and Cody.  The last server I had (before today) was indifferent and almost irritated (white dude, receding hairline, tidy beard).  Today's server was SLOW and also indifferent.  Katie did not stop by after the food was delivered by runners to see if all was well.  After 8 minutes I flagged down a busser to advise that my mom was missing spinach,one of the five portions of her Nosh, which reminded me that my last nosh had also been served missing the spinach.  How do  you leave off one of five things?!  A side of spinach was delivered. It was a grown up size and I was jealous.  Katie eventually came to ask about dessert, we asked for a menu, she delivered and then disappeared.  We wanted the warm chocolate buttermilk cake, two of them.  But by the time she returned to learn of this, our disappointment ruined the moment..  The bill, I'm not kidding, took FOREVER.  I sent my mom out ahead of me.  She stopped a manager to chat about the food experience; the manager did acknowledge that the portions were smaller and added that it was because people were taking leftovers home.  Uh, yah, that's called breakfast.  The manager must have cornered Katie to brief her on our disappointment, which only caused me to sit there longer waiting for my credit card.  Katie was sorry we did not enjoy our lunch.  The bill was not adjusted.  No dessert to go offered. Just "Sorry"...for less food, less taste and poor service.

The bussers and runners were AMAZING.  Somehow that hasn't changed.  They are professional, diligent and cooperative.  

Tonto, I'm out.

Two words... buttermilk calamari!  Melt in your mouth calamari was the perfect way to start our dinner.  I had the salmon and it was cooked to perfection.  My husband had the short ribs and enjoyed every bite.  This place did not disappoint and we had a really enjoyable dinner.

The entire room is wood wall to wall and dark.  We didn't sit on the patio because it was warm outside.  Service was good in the beginning but about 2/3 through our meal the server was gone and never seen again until the bill was finally brought to us.  We ordered grass fed beef burgers and they were rather dry.  Nothing was special just ordinary you could get anywhere.  Kind of pricey for ordinary fair.  I wouldn't return.

The food here used to be outstanding, not today...we both ordered the tonto burger $13.50 ea. I don't know where they are getting there beef from these days but it was horrible and the fries soggy!!Our waitress Cara did not" cara" a bit about service, had to wait at least 15 minutes for our bill! We would always bring out of town guests here for the food and views...won't be doing that anytime soon!!

Service was great...food so so. Salmon special was not great. Chips and salsa was enough for 8 of us. They sat us in the patio and although there were heaters it was very uncomfortable. Wouldn't choose to return.

Came here for the first time with my girlfriend and her food was great! My tacos were decent at best, but that burger she had (goat cheese burger) was amazing! The only knock I have for this place is the corn tortillas were stale and it smelled a bit like there was a sewage issue. Sounds worse than it really was, but overall it was a good experience. I'll be back to see if those things have been resolved!

Tonto Bar & Grill is always a great place to grab a drink and some appetizers after a round of golf.  It's also a great place for lunch and dinner.  I can't say I've ever had a bad meal or bad experience here.  I also can't say I've ever been "wowed" here either.  Overall, it's just a really great place to relax and have a few drinks or a great meal.

It's Sunday. You got the special car out of the garage and need a good destination to take it that'll allow you to open it up on the way.  And it's been way too long since the last vacation so that your shoulders seem permanently affixed to your ears.  A trip to Tonto Grill left me feeling like some might feel from an afternoon at the spa - if one were into spa treatments.  After finally getting around the 40MPH-in-the-50MPH-zone signtseers, we were able to get full throttle for a few miles before reaching that No Car Fun Zone called Carefree.  But it was enough.  Let's drive over to Cave Creek.

Our food was more than enough.  Started with a cocktail, which got me a weird look from the waitress but she politely obliged...they must not do much cocktail business at lunch.  It wasn't so great, so think I'll stick to iced tea or wine in the future.  The food was outstanding.  The sesame and poppy seed encrusted bread they left at the table was full of flavor and just the right level of chewy.  I got the day's special - lamb chops on cranberry-orange risotto.  Though the lamb was a bit pinker than the medium I ordered, it was still excellent; so tender and full of juicy flavor.  The risotto was amazing - nuff said.  Lunch partner loved the open faced steak sandwich sitting on a pile of mashed potatoes and topped with a tempura battered onion ring.  Of course I snarfed the leftovers. The wine based sauce with mushrooms was wonderful.  Wait staff was very eager to please and gladly fulfilled every request, but usually they did it before we had to.  Creme brulee for dessert was some of the best I've had.  So we sat and sat at our patio table on the green tree-lined golf course.  After a bit there was a distinct popping sound - ears releasing their grip of shoulders.  aaaaahhhhh

Came here for lunch today on a business trip and can't say enough about how awesome this place is and the scenery was...settled right on the golf course and majestic mountain views all around is the setting for this place.  Immediately when you walk up you can smell the food permeating from here and I was immediately looking forward to what was to come. Walking in a very rustic old southwest feeling and an awesome patio setting. We were greeted right away by our server and she went over the daily specials. I personally decided on the BBQ salmon and wow this was cooked perfectly and the sweet potatoes and spaghetti squash were amazing. This a great lunch sized portion and very light. Great hidden little gem and highly recommend you stopping here for lunch or dinner if you are in the area.

I'm writing this on behalf of my parents' experience.
My parents drove to this restaurant from Mesa (50 minutes each way) for their 27th Anniversary, and made reservations for Saturday night because my mother had been here before for lunch and loved the view and ambience. 
They asked to be seated on the patio, but was told by the hostess that it would be 45 minutes, and they ended up being seated in a not-so-great location by the door. They viewed a number of empty tables on the patio, and noticed people being seated on the patio. They then went back to the hostess and explained that it was their anniversary and wondered if they could be seated on the patio or another better location, and they were rudely told once again that they couldn't be seated on the patio or moved to a better location because it's a highly sought after area, and if they want to sit on the patio they would have to wait 30 minutes or they should have asked about it when they made the reservation (which wasn't made clear over the phone). 
They ended up not leaving, and endured additional poor service - water wasn't refilled, food took a long time, bill took forever (they had to hunt someone down to get it to them), etc. The restaurant attempted to make up for it by giving them one truffle on a plate with "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate, which they denied because of the poor service and horrible experience. My parents rarely go out, and when they do they dress up and want to go somewhere nice, so this experience left my mother in tears. No one was accommodating, the service was horrible and everyone was rude to them. This is shameful for a restaurant to do to a couple who are trying to celebrate a special occasion, so they will never make that drive again and go back to this horrible restaurant.

Came for AZ restaurant week and It did not disappoint. The smell of the food cooking alone is amazing. Love the AZ decor and ambiance. The menu showcased some of their best dishes. I did crab cakes as my appetizer, the filet as my meal and lemon merengue pie as dessert. My hunny did the crab cakes, salmon, and then chocolate dessert. ALL of it was Delicious! Amazing presentation! We sat outside and it was gorgeous. The service was good. The steak was top notch! We will be back :)
Awsome setting offering indoor-outdoor seating.    Something for everyone to eat.   Great service, reasonable price.   Suggest reservations as they are busy.

I wish I could give this another star. This has always been one of my favorite restaurants. I love the ambiance and always bring out of town guests here.
The other night we ordered the corn chowder, which I always thought was the best in the area. It was nothing like it had been for the last several years. We asked our server what happened...her reply was...well maybe tonight's chef made it differently!  What? People return to restaurants because of consistency.
We were a bit disappointed....will go back, but not for a while.
Great food and cuisine.  The mescal and three sisters were a nice touch.  Food was well prepared and the service was outstanding. I highly recommend

We always take out of town guests here for the amazing views of the golf course and great food. We almost always see some wildlife right around sunset on the patio. Very friendly servers. Even the basic burger is delicious right up to the entrees.

We are in a dessert coma.   The chocolate cake is crazy good.  The fruit sorbets are also incredible.   We enjoyed our meals during restaurant week.  Special highlight was the root beer short ribs.  Yummy!  Really enjoyed ourselves.
ALWAYS count on the grill for good food, service and a terrific view. Tonto for lunch, Cartwrights for dinner.   :-)

First time here, we sat at the bar, Julie was the sweetest bartender. She recommended an appetizer and asked us very often how everything was. She made an amazing margarita! She made our whole afternoon, we will be back very soon!

My husband chose to come here for his birthday dinner last night and we've dropped our review from 4.5 stars to 3.  When checking other reviews today I saw comments on the wonderful basket of bread. We spent $215. before the tip and never saw nor were we offered any bread with our dinner. The Gemill chicken pasta was very much enjoyed as was the Schnitzel.  The Walleye was good tasting but Mushy which made me wonder if it was real Walleye or just not fresh. Being from Minnesota and eat our share of Walleye, this didn't hit the mark. Comparing the picture of the Walleye meal to a picture 1 year ago of the same meal, the quantity of fish was reduced by 1/3 (2 fish sticks instead of 3). The Black Cod for $38. Tasted very fishy and we all knows that means not fresh.  The corn chowder was good, the squash soup, only fair...mostly cream and barely more than room temperature.  The birthday boy had a side house salad for $9. which he described as old and wet, not fresh and crunchy.  The menu was more limited than we remember, though they still had my favorite wine and the manhattans were very good.  Comparing the cute pair of good chocolate truffles in a 'paper chest' to the huge piece of ice cream (mud) pie that the Tonto Verde Mesquite Grill gives for a birthday dessert that can generously shared by 4...even 6, it doesn't compare.  All in all, our new favorite place is the Mesquite Grill.
Great atmosphere and food selections are always changing- great place to eat a relaxing lunch and the food quality is exceptional. excellent service

Always spot on, always the happening place and excellent views and atmosphere.  We have been coming here for years and never once had a bad experience.  The wait staff is spot on and always friendly.  HIGHLY recommend this place either for lunch or dinner, you can't go wrong.

I have been wanting to try this place ever since I saw it on 'Check Please Arizona' (PBS) a few months ago. I finally got to go for my birthday last night and was not disappointed. First of all, I love that they have a gluten free menu and not just one or two items, on the contrary there are quite a few GF menu items to order. If you are GF, please let your server know right away and they will bring out freshly baked GF bread for you. It was just scrumptious! The butter melted on it and was so yummy. 
Our server was really on point. I wish I could remember her name, she was very attentive without hovering over us. The busboys were always making sure our waters were filled. The ambiance was really great. The interior dining area is picturesque, Old West-ish but cozy, warm and yet classy.
I started off with a Pinot Noir and the Tonto House Salad . The salad was wonderful and the size was perfect(appetizer size). My friend got a Merlot and the Caesar salad. For my entree I selected the Ancho Chili-Rubbed Filet. Oh. My. Word. Probably one of THE best steaks I have ever had. Medium rare done to perfection. The presentation was quite lovely.
My yfriend got the Mesquite Wood-Grilled Venison Tenderloin Medallions. Had a bite of that and it was just divine. Save room for dessert because you will be sad if you don't. I got the GF/vegan Chocolate Cake, it was served with raspberries, a raspberry sauce and vanilla ice cream. My friend got the creme brulee. SO good. Seriously, we were in a food coma by the time we hobbled out to the car. The sun was setting and naturally it was another gorgeous Arizona sunset, a perfect ending to one of the best meals I have ever had.

We go here often for the ambience and the view and sitting outside on the patio. The food is just so so, and they never really change the menu ever. And now they charge for bread. It's not a very friendly place for service, but it's nice to sit outside.

The Tonto Bar and Grill use to be a favorite of mine when I was in the Carefree, AZ area, after tonight I'm not willing to make the drive from Goodyear to Cave Creek just to eat there.  As usual the food was great, but the service suffered as I've not experienced before. We were seated across from the door between the kitchen and the dining room where wait staff were constantly coming and going, but it gets better. At one point a waiter was entering the dining room from the kitchen with a plate in each hand, he kicked the kitchen door open so hard with his foot that the door sprung back and knocked one plate from his hand, which landed on the floor and broke splattering plate material and food. Shortly after, a second waiter came through the kitchen floor and slipped on whatever was on the floor (heavy Mexican tiles), landing on his bottom, and broke several more plates and splattering food which hit the back of my guests feet. My one guest was also hit on the backs of her legs with pieces of the broken plates (we picked up three large pieces of broken plate before leaving). Staff came over and apologized even though this was not their place, where was the owner or Manager? The young gentleman who fell apologized to us even though he should have been sent immediately to the urgent care since I'm sure he must have hurt something in the fall and he did admit that his elbow was quite sore, but he had work to finish.

Have been for Lunch and Happy Hour and have not been dis appointed! Great lunch food and enough variation to make most people happy. And a great place to take out of town guests. You can sit right next to one of the golf course greens and watch some golfing. Happy hour food is not huge portions, but tasty too!!!

Took out of town guests here, and wanted to impress. We had reserved lower patio seating, and everything turned out great. Ambience excellent, food was fine, and the service very good. All in all, for value, the best restaurant in the area.

Great atmosphere, patio and service. Delicious bread and lunch menu. Our party of 4 loved every item we ordered.

One of the best S/W inspired restaurants in the entire valley. Far better than most valley S/W/Mexican restaurants and well worth the drive.
I like the setting and the ambiance but I think the owners are really greedy. The food is so overpriced and service has gone really downhill. What a shame ! I used to love Tonto Bar and Grill.

My favorite restaurant on the planet. Great staff and amazing food. The root beer braised short ribs are my favorites. The sweet potato accompaniment is fabulous. That being said, there is nothing on the menu I haven't loved. Great wine list, too. Highly recommended.

Too many good things to say about EVERYTHING!
If you haven't been, get there! Every thing on the menu is tasty.
Love this place!
Gorgeous setting and wonderful food!  I had "BLT Revival".  It was amazing!  The cornmeal-fried green tomatoes were an excellent touch and I couldn't get enough of the lemon-basil aoli.
A favorite of ours. Enjoy sitting out on the patio next to the golf course, service is always outstanding and food is amazing

My husband and I just went here for our anniversary. Overall, I say it was good. It doesn't quite match what I remember it being years ago, but maybe that's just rose colored "back in the day" glasses. 

We shared the crab cakes for an appetizer, and they were pretty good. We also both got the mushroom soup, which we both agree was really great! 

For our entrees, I got the orange BBQ salmon, and my husband got the bison ribeye. Now, I really liked the salmon, and the sauce on top of it, but the veggies underneath had a taste I didn't much like, and the little mounds of veggies on the sides were pretty tasteless. My husband also wasn't a fan of whatever his bison had been placed on top of, though he enjoyed the bison itself. That was a bit of a let down on a $40 plate. Ouch.

We both also got desserts. He got the creme brûlée  and I got the apple pumpkin stack. His dessert looked really nice, and he said it was good. Mine was just ok, with not much in terms of flavor standing out. Very so-so. Our plates were decorated nicely with anniversary wishes, and we got a little box of chocolate as well for the occasion, which was nice. 

One rather big issue we had was the temperature of the room. It was boiling. There was a fire going and it really wasn't needed. I get it for the atmosphere, but we didn't enjoy eating our dinners while sweating at the table.

If you are in town and you want to try this place and are lucky enough to score a reasonable table, you might enjoy this experience overlooking the golf course. They charge for everything, including bread. The dishes are a little cullinary experiment. It is nice if you are looking for something different. I would not suggest making a special effort to try this place. Desserts are delightful but not worth the expense for the three courses.

The harvest salad was great.  Went here for lunch with my husband and mother-in-law (sans child) and had a really wonderful lunch.  I had the heirloom gazpacho and it was fantastic :)  I tried it due to other Yelp reviews and it was definitely worth a try.  We had lunch on the patio, which was nicely shaded, and it was the first time in my life that I actually thought a golf course view was pleasant.  (I'm not into golf, so I generally don't care about golf courses).  Had a New Zealand wine with my salad - super.  I wouldn't recommend this establishment for small children, but it was a great get-away place to have lunch without your small child ;)

My husband and I had the pleasure of attending a wedding here on Saturday night.  The service was top notch, the passed appetizers were tasty and the seated dinner was off the charts.

I opted for the tumbleweed salad, which was romaine lettuce, black beans, corn and some amazing BBQ ranch dressing.  I was a bit unsure as I am a salad purist, lettuce, cheese, bacon bits and croutons but I literally cleaned my plate.  For my entree, I opted for the filet, medium rare, served with asparagus and scalloped potatoes.  This entree was perfectly content owed and so delicious that I got the uneaten portion to go.  Our hotel didn't have a microwave, so I put it into a zippy bag and brought it home to Texas.

Other salads, the beet salad and the arugula ones were good but I think the tumbleweed was the best.

Other entrees included the salmon (cooked perfectly), the sanddabs (meh, according to our friend), the venison and the NY Strip....all good.

Hubby and I so enjoyed the ambiance and the food, so we returned today at lunch.  We started with the appetizer of three salsas, guacamole and two kinds of chips and Indian fry bread.  All were good, but the guacamole was the star here.

Hubby ordered the salmon entree and ate almost all of it.  It was perfectly cooked to rare, which he said was the only place ever who has delivered on that request!

I opted for the cheeseburger, medium rare, and it came out pink, juicy and flavorful.  It came with a house salad, which I upgraded to the tumbleweed, at the cost of a full side salad for $9.

Overall, this place has a very relaxing and pleasant atmosphere and food variety and taste combinations you won't find elsewhere!

Took clients to dinner here, the service was excellent, we were seated immediately, my steak was juicy, tender and very tasty, seasoned perfectly. The Salmon that others had was reported very good, but maybe a touch too much glaze. We also had two deserts the Key-lime and Dark Chocolate cake, both were amazing and melted in your mouth.
