Portions were not huge but just right. It was a very good experience.
I went here at night so I didn't get to see the great views, but the dinner was good especially since I wasn't paying :)

My partner and I decided  give it a go after not being there for a year........We felt at that point that it was getting a little tired.....But tonight.....It is hard to describe how good and solid the food was. Really, and the service, 5 star all the way....the food was   just straight away the best we have had there, ever.....amazing and you can't believe how we were really not sure what to expect, but this was just so welcomed. A really nice time and the setting, Terrific Cesar Salad,  Sand Dabs with mashed potatoes, tiny organic carrots and sweet green peas in the pod, with an amazing sauce , along with the home made bread and the butter and what a great night.......can't beat it anywhere in the area....

I saw an ad for this restaurant in a magazine and decided to give it a try.  Good marketing I guess?  We drove up and although it was a bit hidden, the view is amazing.  The inside is really pretty - nice touches to make you feel like you are in a native American dwelling.  

We started with the 3 sisters salsas and chips.  OMG the chips were all homemade and delicious - there was a warm bread/soft taco and then the tortilla chips.  The salsas were all really good and interesting.  Each one had a different flavors and the portions were huge - easily enough for 4 people.

I ordered the BLT with house salad.  The dressing was delicious I seriously would have bought some if they bottled it.  The sandwich was huge!  Slices on avocado and huge strips of bacon, what more could you ask for?

This was one of the best meals I've had in Arizona and I'd go back in a heart beat.

Tonto has nice indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor is especially pretty weather permitting. It's not unusual to find wildlife roaming around here. I've seen bobcats and javelinas on prior visits.

The food is also really good. The salads are always good. Their appetizers are delicious and portions are large enough to share. 

Their dinner entrees are really good too. Recently had their burger and it came out juicy and flavorful with tons of toppings. 

It could get crowded here during the weekends so I'd recommend making reservations. Parking is decent and there are street parking if the parking lot gets full.

Looking for a romantic place to take my BFF @cburg we visited Tonto's. After a great walk through the neighborhood and an amazing Tontorita (highly recommended) in the patio, we enjoyed a marvelous dinner. This place would clearly be a five star if only we could have found some way of arranging a reservation during sunset. My advice? Book ahead. (And plan to enjoy a Tontorita, or three)
Best sea scallops iv ever had. Great atmosphere -and view of the golf course outside. Plus the service was amazing.

We went with a group of 14 for New Year's Eve and everyone had a great time. Everyone enjoyed their food, not one person had a complaint. Everyone said their meals were perfect. The service was great especially what is probably their busiest night. I has the walleye and it was delicious and perfectly cooked as was my husband's filet mignon. The sweet potatoe soup was delicious and I think we all could have had more it was so tasty. Good prices and decent size portions with great atmosphere. We will certainly return.

Food is always excellent. I only gave 3 stars because each time I've gone to the restaurant side the service is pretty bad. Had trouble getting the correct drinks and then refills were almost impossible to get. The bar however has excellent service with friendly staff.
Wonderful food! Out of our six people, four ordered the walleye. It was wonderful. Hilo was a fantastic and attentive waiter. We highly recommend this restaurant.

If we think about going to dinner in the area, this is always on the top of the list.  Service is usually pretty good (I'd give it 4 stars) but the food and the atmosphere is so great.  Love the walleye and still can't believe they have it here in the damn desert.  Best thing away from the Great Lakes!  The salads are unusual and dressings made from scratch.  The only complaint is there is always too much food so my husband and I have learned to share.  Well, that's not so tough.  Love sitting outside in the evening, yes, even in the heat, since there is a nice breeze when the sun goes behind the hills.  Only been here for dinner and a cocktail party but I understand they serve all day.

A great local restaurant wirh local ingredients.  We have pkayed the adjacent golf course many times and liked to get lunch here. This time we had dinner and for vegans they have a  special menu which is fantastic.  I got the vegetarian nosh which is a choice of various vegetables,  startches, and sauces. They  also have fresh baked bread that you can purchase to start. My two buddies got a Reuben and the other a pasta dish. They both loved their meals. Definitely worth a try.

Excellent selection and wine list. Server was all up on her organic grass fed/finished schpiel which delighted me to no end. Split the shrimp tacos which were delish. Not a bad dish at the table. I'd RUN back!

We were a party of 9 with 2 small children. Our server was fabulous and the food was to die for. This is one of my favorite restaurants. We were on the patio and the sunset was so beautiful. It was a great night.

OMG. This place is a total hidden gem up in Cave Creek. I'll keep this short and sweet.

1. sit outside near the golf course
2. order the root beer braised short ribs
3. order a burger
4. if you're going with a large party get the salsa assortment for an appetizer.

This is a perfect date place. It's quaint, has the ambience of Lon's for a fraction of the cost. IMO, their service is in the top 5 of all restaurants I've been to in Arizona. There's no way you can go wrong with Tonto Bar and Grill.

Absolutely ideal. Food was delicious & patio in the sunshine looking over the lush golf course was so relaxing. The corn chowder is a MUST!  Thought my husband was going to lock the bowl in public. He always talks about how a dish can be improved.  Instead he thought the crab cakes were the best he has ever had. The Cobb salad was fresh & light. Perfect afternoon meal after some time on the tennis courts.

I can't give this place enough stars!!! I love the food, ambiance, service-it's the best! They change their menu from time to time but if they have the Reuben sandwich on the menu-get that as they use house made pastrami. In the past, they have also had homemade Gazpacho (but I think they may have taken it off the menu)-that's another favorite! The golf course view is a relaxing setting. Love this place!
For $14 you get a salad which is so small. The quality of food is not good the quantity is way too small and the prices our way too hi. Might be ok for out of state visitors who would not come back.

We haven't been to TontoGrill in a couple of years. We decided to check it out and we're very pleasantly surprised. We went early before it was crowded and had a delightful dinner overlooking the golf course. They had the heater on to keep us toasty warm. Service was excellent and everything about our meal was great. I had the chicken pasta which was better than I remembered it. It is a very nice relaxing atmosphere when it is not hustling and bustling with people.

Tonto has very good food, but I expect more for such a pricey restaraunt. I ordered the Corn Chowder with a Cobb Salad. The chowder is incredible, but there salads tend to be soaked in dressing. The waiter brought them both out at the same time, which was a put-off for a restaraunt that touts itself on the higher end. Overall great service when we go there, but bringing out both entrees at the same time is something you'd expect at a diner, not a higher end establishment. I was told by our waiter, that was the way they do it. Maybe he was new, but he didn't seem to get it.
